z6izigOH4HFIyIEq8Dfe3Q.text: My co-workers and I frequent this place and I can honestly say I've never had a bad beer or a bad meal here!  Their bahn mi sandwiches are delicious and we'll balanced.  Their small plates and appetizers are excellent and change with feedback from customers, keeping the menu fresh and new, without eliminating the favorites.  Lastly, the reason we come here, is the beer selection.  It is hands down one of the best in Las Vegas, rotating regularly with plenty of variety!  They clearly support the local craft brewery scene, while still  keeping it interesting with both new and craft brew favorites.  By far one of my favorite places.

n2MaqLEwVNxLB9G2d2BuaA.text: So we were cruising home from Bryce Canyon, Utah just looking for a nice little gastroPub to have a beer and some good food. JMXinIaCMNOsMlAA7uiCZg.text: Went here for some food and to watch the Golden Knights game. They have a bar area and some tables where you seat yourself. They have a wide selection of beers on tap with a menu full of fusion type bar foods. They have TVs playing sports on every side so you don't miss the games.   We tried the fried deviled eggs (appetizer menu) and traditional poutine (fries menu). Both were excellent and I'd recommend trying them out. They also had board games available to play at your table.

a2_cfNcbVBvj4XVial3wUg.text: First I had a great beer on tap, and was like, this is dank af. Then I grubbed some garbage fries, and was like No dude, this can't get any better. Then, sitting here looking at their Instagram, I was like, Fine, twist my damn arm, I'll have some darn beer cheese I guess. You know what? Motherloving brutal. Hardcore gnarcore. I saw Nine Inch Nails play the perfect setlist at The Joint last night, and holy screws, it's like that setlist is in my funkyhumpin mouth. I feel love. Like, I'm no longer dead inside because of this beer cheese. Are you kidding me???? I hate y'all. I'll be back. Hopefully with tighter concealing pants, because this food has me so effing excited rn.

NVUQbqGdl53GVanGaOCwlQ.text: I reaaaaally enjoyed this find! Came in at 1 am, during the late night happy hour and sat at the bar. The decor is nice and reminded me of a bar in California. They have a nice selection of beers. I came in because I saw they had Cali Creamin' on tap from a photo another yelper posted. When I asked for it I was told that this bar rotated through their beers so they don't always have the same selections. I thought that was an awesome way to keep people coming back to try different beers. The  counter is super cool! I didn't realize it until the end, but the silver panel is meant to keep your drinks cold.  They let you sample if you want. They have a nice selection of sours which a lot of breweries don't have in Las Vegas. Their happy hour menu is good, I definitely recommend pairing the food with a beer or a drink. It is definitely drunk food lol, salty and fried everything. But even if you don't drink the food is still a plus.   I ordered -fried chicken skins -fried deviled eggs -chicken banh mi -original banh mi  I liked everything! I love fried chicken skins (especially from Carson Kitchen), but these were different. They reminded me more of chicharon with the texture and the breading on it and the sauce was like vinegar. If you're Filipino then you'll know what Im talking about lol. I liked it, they give you a large portion. The deviled eggs were delicious, I've never had them fried before. And both of the banh mis were good! I appreciated the fact that the bread was on the softer side because nothing sucks more than bread that cuts the inside of your mouth (ahemmm Lee's).   The bartender there was awesome, she definitely was cool to talk to and told us a lot about the place. The owners are from San Diego, which to me, made more sense of the beer selection, decor, and ambiance. They have cool events to look forward to, and they are planning to come out with a brunch menu on Saturday's and Sunday's. I can't wait for that because who doesn't love brunch? I will be coming back!

JBn51brHaKHT-xpJF5N4Eg.text: Absolutely excellent. Bozo was our server (even though at the time he was the bartender as well). This dude was swamped with covers but still was able to greet us promptly and fulfill our order in timely fashion. The banh mi sandwiches were incredible. We got their traditional (perhaps signature, I can't remember) and pork belly. Holy moly y'all. I have been in the biz for 20 years. I know good food. This place has good food.   Our party was not drinking on this occasion, but as a downtown bartender, I can assure you, their beer selection is on point. Local breweries are proudly represented as well as hard hitting micros.   I can't wait to come back here. Place is bomb, yo.

aVWEqsGr-TZWHgH1a6YeuQ.text: I am elated to have discovered a beer Pub with a myriad of craft & unique seasonal beers. I love the casual yet sexy setting, which reminds me of a boutique hotel w/ stylish interior designs.   The unique menu offers comfort food selections, balanced by fresh ingredients, topped with gourmet & delicate flavors. Some of the foods have popular Vietnamese themes, such as cold spring rolls and Banh Mi sandwiches. And there are a ton of delicious American food selections as well.   I like the variety of music selections and/or genres at 595. I also appreciate multiple flat-screen TV's at the pub for people that enjoy watching sports.   Last, but certainly not the least, I like the reasonable pricing of their beer & food items. It is immensely refreshing to have a cool local hangout, instead of walking through smokey, pricey, & noisy casinos.

f_jqmPprx4_Y0zs-Tc6_Ug.text: Three weeks ago my husband and I decided to take 595 for a spin since we live right down the street. We absolutely fell in love with this place it was the best ever!!! The beer, the food, the vibe was awesome!!!! The week after we took our in laws they loved it and have talked about going back constantly even though they live in Henderson. This place is awesome!! Great food and great drinks.  Unfortunately I can't give 5 stars due to a few days ago me and my husband brought our friends to have them try since they all live around the area as well. When we first got there it was completely full and we looked at the bartenders he said it's open seating sit anywhere we sat at the first table available that was for 8 people. We made sure we only used half of the table Incase other people showed up ( we know these places always have to share seats so not a big deal. However at the end of the night after buying drinks, apps, entrees, and more drinks and spending over 100$. We go to the restroom and as I am walking back to the table one of the waitress who didn't even help us rudely says " are you already done we have people waiting you know". We immediately get up pack up and leave my husband didn't get to even finish his beer he just ordered. I understand we were in the wrong here we should have tried to stand or go to the bar since we were only 4 at an 8 table but I have to say I was very disappointed in the way we were talked too. Even if she had said maybe you guys can sit in the bank benches. Other than that horrible everything else is awesome! The food and beer are amazing!

wZakLVCgs0pbDhRdXrfanA.text: The food here is always good. The beer selection is varied and interesting, and the staff are second to none. I love this place!

They went out of their way to make the drink I asked for, the people sitting at the bar were super friendly, and the food was good! I felt like I was on the show Cheers. Haha. I'll be back.

dJmmx2udIPPxT8KNAf-Fcg.text: Pork belly burger may be the best burger in town, Unfortunately it's the only bargain on the menu. I'm shocked they don't charge 20+ based on how they price everything else.  Pricing on everything is asinine, strip prices. Over 2d per 1/3 segment of chicken wing? 7d for a tiny bowl of fries? Chicken skin has a coating that doesn't work for it 7d for small amount. Pork belly Bnah MI has the wrong bun and looks silly with so little content. 8d beers?  Sorry, this is not the strip, and while the burger was fantastic, the rest of the options are laughable.

w_mI54G0QM4APSGz6f7bGw.text: Can't say enough about how lucky I am to have this place so close to my house!!! The hubby and I eat here all the time and for good reason... The food is outstanding! They have an absolute awesome beer selections, always something new and tasty on tap. We have tried most everything on the menu at some point and have come down to what we love the most and always order. I get the pork belly banh mi every time and every time it is perfection!!! The fries are hand cut and really so good. Now the husband has stronger taste buds than I do so he always orders the hot chicken sandwich (think Tennessee hot) and he loves it. Even when he is sweating thru eating it and drinking his weight in water to cool his mouth down, he is ultimately the happiest guy for having ordered it! Now lets get to the cherry on the top of every visit here and that is the bread pudding!! Every time we go in they have a different flavor of bread pudding, once it was traditional, then in the fall it was pumpkin spice, then it was chocolate, they have made a nutella with PB topped one and the one today that I had was s'mores!! I never order bread pudding because if I am being honest, its really not my thing, or so I thought. This is by far better than whatever it is your;e thinking a bread pudding is, this is perfection. Please do yourself a favor and go and see what I'm talking about. I hope everyone that reads this post goes and that this place never goes out of business! The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, the staff are seriously the best, the owner is awesome. Stop driving by and stop in!!!

sMheRcYFWIQZLFFmfpq27w.text: 595 Craft and Kitchen has quickly won a place in my heart. Serving up an intriguingly tasty variety of dishes, they have everything from banh mi to deep fried deviled eggs. I haven't had a single dish that wasn't exceptional and made with love. The burgers are juicy and flavorful, their chicken sandwiches are spicy and fried to perfection and even their popcorn is enhanced with beautifully creative flavors.   What makes this place even better is their ever rotating selections of beer. Focusing on craft beers from all over they carry some of my local favorites as well as breweries from out of state that are exceptional.   Service is always on point as well. Friendly staff, delicious food and a lovely beer selection has easily made this one of my favorite new spots!

For someone who does not smoke this is great to visit as you won't be leaving with a bad smell after hanging out here! I would totally recommend this place.

PN7CF5dDyt1rkRjcr4re-w.text: When friends suggested this place, I was reluctant, as I'd been to the now-closed Elements Martini Bar several times which was its old location.  Old ownership and management was terrible, and I was hesitant, as I assumed they had just reopened under a new name.  I was absolutely wrong.  Our experience at 595 Craft and Kitchen was amazing.  As a group of four at the bar, we attempted to get a table in the dining room after our first round, but the bartender Patrick was able to squeeze the four of us in at the bar as the after work crowd thinned out.  We ordered the beer cheese with pretzels, the dynamite crab dip, the loco moco poutine fries, and four different sandwiches to share.  The appetizers were definitely the stars of all the dishes we ordered, though my hot chicken sandwich was pretty fantastic as well.  What made our experience amazing rests 100% on our bartender for the evening Patrick.  I overheard him giving another guest some advice on IPAs, and his passion for beer definitely shows.  We ordered entirely too many difficult order cocktails, which Patrick never gave us any flack about, as he happily concocted our drinks all evening.  On our drive home we all agreed that had we had another bartender, we weren't sure we would have loved our experience as much as we did.  I would absolutely return.  I have and will continue to recommend this place to friends.  Perfect spot for a beer or two after work or to meet up with friends.  Kudos to new owners and management, and eight thumbs up from the four of us for Patrick.

C1sBPZknRsfY8Le_sCvKzA.text: We came to Vegas for the Baker to Vegas relay race and found this place.  It was great!  The beer selectiin and the knowledge the bar tender had was phenominal and he really took the time to explain things and recommended beers that would appeal to us.  The food looked great, but we'd just eaten so I can't comment...  Next time for sure; two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahhhhhh!

yZxPAVTIEJ0fQ2BN97dSBw.text: My husband and I visited this place over the weekend for a late night dinner. When you first walk in you see the bar and main dining seating to the left. The place is nice and cozy, atmosphere was inviting from the second you step foot inside. It was already off to a good start.   After looking at their list of Appetizers, we decided on the Garbage Nachos. These were freaking fantastic! Brisket, pork belly, chicken, cheese blend, pico, guacamole and cilantro lime crema. These were amazing! It's hard to find good nachos. We really enjoyed these, especially because it wasn't just about overdoing the cheese, they really put together a great balance of ingredients.     After the nachos, we moved on to our main course. My husband ordered their Beer Brined Chicken Wings (Buffalo & Hoisin Sambal). There were delicious, nice and flavorful with a bit of a kick. The hoisin ones were the perfect sticky spicy ratio. To go along with those he decided on their Caesar Salad. This was really good as well. I went with their Pork Belly Burger which was put together with some cabbage slaw, gochujang aioli and fried shallots. The Burger was of course my favorite! Pork Belly was tender and juicy, the burger patty was well seasoned and flavorful. It looked amazing, and the taste matched the look. I highly recommend the pork belly burger.   For drinks, we simply went with an old fashioned- But it was a damn delicious old fashioned! Perfect mix of everything.   The staff was extremely friendly and on top of everything. Our server was very helpful in explaining everything and I specially love the fact that when I asked, he gave me  his opinion no hesitation (he knew and had tasted the menu). I can definitely see us coming back here in the future to try out more of their menu and drinks. Looking forward to visiting during their happy hour as well!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Burger and Fries

WRXP_WdZsKjPb0-sCyRK2w.text: The food was delicious.   Walk in and seat yourself. They will come around with a menu.   They are starting a brunch menu! Woot woot!   The breakfast burrito was SUPER DELICIOUS. Eggs, fries, pork belly, .... holy smokes.... so good.   The Beef brisket Bahn Mi was on point as well. The meat was tender and it dry. The bread was toasted nicely and the marinated daikon was excellent.   The service was good.   Overall I would definitely recommend and come back.

vYQtDD3CMPMFbEmLP68bPQ.text: My wife and I had a dinner meeting here with some associates. We found that the food was good and that the service was great!  We don't drink alcohol but they had a large selection of drinks with an Irish theme. I recommend trying this place.

hjMCr9i15RsrRaT9cGrkGw.text: Nice place to just hang out and have a BEER after a long tiring stressful day. The owner is very accommodating. Love the Asian fusion vibe. Great customer service. Free house beer with yelp check in! What else can you ask for a local Neighborhood bar just around the corner from my house. Nothing else PERIOD.

yqpQ9tFjpTmWt17-fWD-8w.text: Let me start, have you had a bite of something and thought "Son of a b*tch that was good". Well I just did, after the pork belly burger, I had them slap a fried egg on there and that burger was gone so fast.   I had the fried deviled eggs which was good, and the buffalo wings also good but the burger just GET IT.   The Bees Knees, is one of the signature cocktails I ordered. It's misleading... in the classy glass is adorable drink that will slap you lit.    I've visited this place a few times before, it's one of the few gems in Spring Valley. It's too bad it isn't just a bit bigger..finding seats for more than 3 people is gonna be a little challenging but if your cool with bar seating till a table opens up its worth the wait.

BGgC-6d9XCYiRWcF0xkjyQ.text: Delicious food, great ambiance. Fun place to hang out, have a cocktail and enjoy the evening.

kYsC8S86pCNUqW2uJh7dxg.text: Came here for a engagement celebration. They have a wide variety of beers and great food. They have tons of different fries which are to die for.  I had the stoner fries and they were delicious.  They have many different beers so if your one of those like a large variety of beer type of people this is definitely your spot.  The service was great and I was very impressed that they were able to accommodate such a large group.  I have no complaints and can't wait to come here again to try some different brews.

wuN1IIyS_PFgedV0jsvhNA.text: I cruised by 595 for lunch with 2 of my coworkers.  FOOD:  The fried chicken skins were pretty bland. The sweet chili sauce was the only thing that saved it. I think they should use soy sauce + vinegar + chopped onions as a dip instead.  Their signature banh mi was pretty good. It looks like they use higher quality ingredients. But, for $9 I don't think it's worth it .  SERVICE:  3/5.  Im guessing it took around 15-20 min for all of us to our food.  AMBIENCE:  3/5.  It's a small restaurant with a bar.  It's quiet in there, too.  I may try 595 one more time.  Mostly for the drinks though.

Bx3tXH18oONOrIMPppE1Zw.text: Have been here twice. Once for Happy Hour (we didn't really care for the food- chicken wings were undercooked). Staff is really nice & great beer selection. I would recommend going here for a drink but not the food. We wanted to give it a 2nd chance after trying for HH. Everything I've tasted here hasn't been good. Crab dip was ok but very oily & hot chicken sandwich lacked flavor. It was hot but tasteless. I can't say I'll go back.

l_JT3dyNSd3tuS_BdZltqQ.text: Neat little place off the strip with uber chill vibes, fantastic brews and tasty, unique plates made for sharing.   We came late on a weekend night for some nosh, not an entire meal and there was absolutely no wait. We were greeted immediately by our awesome waitress Ruda. She and Chelsea who brought us our dishes, filled waters attentively, and made recommendations were super personable and should absolutely be commended. They made our entire visit extra enjoyable.   The table shared:  -Fried deviled eggs with Gochujang Aioli. Beautifully plated and well received by hubs.   -Thai Cashew Hummus with Pickled Veggies and delicious light crispy House Crackers. So different than any hummus I've tasted before! It definitely had a kick but not too much the littles couldn't enjoy it. The house made crackers were awesome!   -Hand Cut House Fries perfectly fried and salted, served with Sambal Ketchup, Gochujang Aioli or Roasted Garlic Aioli. I hear their poutine is popular and came recommended, but plain was a veg friendly option that was certainly delish.   All plates were very well liked and we would recommend them all. The menu has a heavy Asian influence, but you'll find anything from burgers to a handful of Bahn Mi, even a popcorn of the day. Love that last one!  Vegan and GF options available.  Lighter options such as salads too.   For a sweet ending the crew went for the bread pudding of the day which was a salted caramel they really loved. The Chocolate Olive Oil Budino Chocolate Soil + Sea Salt + Candied Peanut seems to be a fan favorite however.   The craft list which is an obvious huge draw was very impressive and interesting and included many locals. It offered something for every beer drinker's taste...ambers, pilsners, IPA, blondes and pales, porters and stouts. They are heavy on the fruit here ...blueberry wheat, boysenberry sour, tangerine pale ales, a blood orange option, even pear or pineapple cider. I'm personally happy to see any pumpkin brews on a menu in the summertime! Oh, and beer aficionados, they're on tap finder if you want to see what's happening.   If brews aren't your thing, the cocktails were creative and included the oh so trendy shrubs and bitters. They had intriguing rock and roll-ish names too.   If you're looking to stay off the beaten path in a more casual, neighborhood bar type atmosphere and just taking a load off while enjoying brews and smaller bites, this place should be considered.  We had a great time just chilling and snacking here.

1xbkD0cRupM92u3qvvOM_g.text: This would be an automatic 5 Star  review if the temp inside wasn't 85degrees in the middle of a hot day.   This bar is one of my favorites as the beer selection on tap is always rotating an eclectic variety of treats. Odell and Pure Project are hard to come by in the valley so I take a bow to you 595... get it!  Also, another highlight here is the kitchen and the amazing selections of poutine, pork belly dishes made in house, and refreshing salad compilations. I drive across town for the pork belly burger. The spicy slaw and crispy pork belly just hits the spot without fail.   There is a metal strip that runs the bar top that is iced to keep your glass chilled as you enjoy beverage after beverage. Pretty cool idea you guys!

G4f1J9ZjdhXm4qkEppVO_w.text: So far I'm here because 1. I realized my first review was very shallow and I can't understand why as usually I go into detail in regards to review.   Also, I had take out last time which I failed to mention.   So I thought to myself , well that is not cool. I decided to come in again by myself so I could really soak up the experience.   One of the first question I ask the lady at the bar in regards to the Poutine was "How is it prepared ?"   She hit me back with a side look and said "what do you mean?" And just stared at me a bit.   She then said "fries , Gravy a fried egg scallions. "   ...... so far I'm displeased just by her asinine attitude.   The crowd at the present are mostly middle aged or late 40's.   So while I appreciate that you went into great detail being the public representative of your company I'd more so appreciate a person who isn't obviously miserable to be here at her job.   I deal with many people through out the day and she isn't as welcoming or informative as me id like, however I'll not dote on.   She asked me what type of wings did I want I said I didn't know she told me the selection. She said what she liked best so I decided to pick those.   So now I await my poutine and these wings made with a Korean marinade with Hoysen and gochujang.   I'm Korean so I'm taking her suggestion. I'm also understanding so I'm not going to assume this will be the attitude for the remainder of my meal.   I do dish off a heavy attitude myself when disrespect is concerned.   I'll brb.  Ok as far as the wings and using Korean ingredients. I'd honestly love for them to have more flavor. Korean food is well known for being super flavorful.   They weren't horrible they just didn't hit that high peak of Asian expectations I have when using my homeland ingredients.   I'd love to come in and show you the best way to prepare these to be honest.   Also the poutine was much better. The fries were freshly made. The gravy is way too thick in my opinion. The curds were perfectly melted as opposed to my ice cold curds I had prior.   Overall the atmosphere was super chill. Everyone was enjoying the Golden Knights game , the bar maid's attitude didn't bug me as much as she seemingly is there only for the drinkers and I was sitting at the bar.   The quality of the food is good and I only had a few things. I took some hummus to go and even though we are super Asian we just could not get past all the sweet notes and how you pair it with cracker or pita bread.   I think some veggies with that sort of hummus would be spot on. It wasn't as velvety as I like my hummus, which does tell you they make it in-house yet they could work on the texture a bit.

Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KQgCSu6DLh3ajL5bChvxSA.text: This gastropub has a lot of Asian-inspired dishes. They also use a lot of salt which is not Asian-inspired. If you want Instagrammable food porn, go when the sun is still out. Otherwise, it's daaark in this place which is perfect if your dating confidence is not high. The lack of lighting and the good drinks (per friends who drink) are your friends.  I've tried several dishes here...  Fried Deviled Eggs:  Just what it is plus, a gochujang aioli dipping sauce. I think it's the dipping sauce that makes this salty. Eat without the dip and it's just fine. 3.5/5  Crispy Chicken Skins: Lightly breaded chicken skins, deep-fried. Comes with a sweet chili dipping sauce. Possibly the best appetizer on their menu. Savory and crispy. 4/5  Beer Cheese: Pretzels you dip into beer cheese. I didn't like this. I don't even know how to describe it other than add beer to Cheez Wiz and dip bread into it. 2/5  Banh Mi: Pretty good but nothing spectacular. Comparable to banh mi you can get from Chinatown. 3/5  Pork Belly Burger: I was under the impression I'd get like a pork belly sandwich. What I got instead was a thick beef patty topped with pork belly! Yum! But what was missing was the acidity to cut off the fattiness and richness of the beef and pork belly. Texture-wise, they could've added more crunch to this burger with some fresh crisp veggies. 3/5  Fries: Really crunchy fried potatoes. Well-seasoned. I think they fry them twice to get the perfect crunch. Ask for regular ketchup if you don't want their salty dipping sauces. 4/5  Dynamite Crab Dip: Chunks of imitation crab in sriracha aioli with a side of different types of bread/ cracker. I think they could've shredded the imitation crab a bit so when you scoop up some dip, you get a nice even ratio of crab and aioli instead of a big chunk of crab coated in aioli. 2/5  Vermicelli Noodle Salad: Not sure why this is called a salad as there was not enough greens/ vegetables for it to count as a salad. You can add proteins to it like grilled garlic chicken, pork belly, etc for a few bucks more. The dressing is watery, vinegary and has a nice spicy kick to it - it goes well with the dish. 3/5  Furikake Tuna Burger:  Ground tuna patty - yeah, I don't like the thought of that. I'd have to skip writing about this.  Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich: Crispy fried chicken.  Chocolate Budino: Bittersweet chocolate that's smooth and creamy.   As you can tell, I just got lazy towards the end of this review. This place isn't as exciting as the other reviews make it seem. There's usually just 1 or 2 servers/ bartenders working so, if more than 3 tables are occupied, the service can be slow/ lacking. Also, it seems like every time we come here, there's always people making out or necking. LOL.

Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Budino
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Furikake Tuna Burger

bC_MlRvgbXzRVWPgnGx8Cg.text: Here's the lowdown ~~  Place is super cute, and I love the aesthetic.  Service is super friendly and I loved that our server was very attentive, but I would've appreciated a little more space and time to ponder the menu and enjoy our meal. Otherwise, she gave some great recommendations and was knowledgeable about the menu.  I really enjoyed the fried deviled eggs. Super original and delicious idea. I was super skeptical, but it wasn't greasy at all. Plus, the breading was very well done.  I was not a fan of the heirloom tomato salad. I thought the food quality was good, but I wasn't a fan of the dressing. Something about it reminded me of barbecue sauce, but my boyfriend loved it, so I think it's just up to preference.   My boyfriend loved the signature banh mi. He thought the pork was amazing and said it was the best Viet sandwich he ever had.  Overall, even though I was kind of disappointed in my salad, their menu looks super promising. I'll definitely be back for drinks and the food (especially that broccolini banh mi).

KQkTa0THQPo5lBbMLH2-LA.text: Great spot. I've been here a few times to watch sports events. Food is A+ and I liked their beer selection. Definitely recommended.

1f3Niq61312-pWOh4lAqNw.text: Food was ok. Place was small. Slow service. No communication between workers. Had hard one getting our orders correctly. I was excited to try this place out but was disappointed. I don't know what else to say.

mWdMTCSH8Ev7S-DKFRMalQ.text: This is a True hidden gem. Beer selection is awesome and the food lives up to the hype. Pork Belly sandwiches are beyond describable, the fresh spring rolls are huge and fresh, and that chicken sandwich looks like the definition of love.

G1XEwupoQfi8Funl6Db-BA.text: I came with some friends and we ordered: Thai Cashew Hummus, Crispy Chicken Skins, Beer Brined Chicken Wings in Gochuhang and Buffalo, Beef Brisket Banh Mi, and Beer Cheese Poutine. Oh and the special of the day which was Fried Salmon.  The Thai Cashew Hummus was REALLY good. A little spicy and different than anything I've had before. They give you quite a lot. I would definitely go back just for this hummus.  Beer Cheese Poutine is definitely an appetizer to share. So good though!  Crispy Chicken Skins were a nice snack, but the batter was a little to heavy for my liking. A little less and it would have been perfect.  I do not recommend getting the wings if you're expecting Gochujang flavor because it definitely was NOT that. They were ok, a little too dry. The buffalo wasn't anything special. I asked for a side of Hoison sambal sauce because I was curious what it tasted like. NOT like Hoison at all. it was too vinegary and I did not like it.  Beef Brisket Banh Mi was also a tad dry. Pouring some of the chili sauce from the Chicken Skin helped make it much better. So I'd recommend asking for some on the side if that's the case for you.  Surprisingly we didn't try any of the beers. I'd definitely come back for some of the food we liked and to try some beers.

QJzjRdq0U_HqvhbWcDSt9A.text: Went to Went to check out this place with a buddy. We tried a couple of the specialty drinks, an appetizer and a couple of entrees. The Chartreuse Mule and Mezcal Cup were a bit much. You probably have to have a very particular taste to enjoy them. Overall, the food and drinks were pretty good. I'd recommend trying them out for something a bit different than typical bar food.

5eb2y9EhwcGoehk806Z-sQ.text: 595 Craft And Kitchen is a very welcome addition to the neighborhood. I stumbled upon this place while looking for good pubs on the west side of town on yelp, and decided to check it out. It's a relatively smaller space, but with plenty of big tables and bar area to fit any size group. I've been back a few times and so far the food and beer selection has always been good. All of their Bahn Mi sandwiches, as well as their garbage fries and burgers are really great, and the fried deviled eggs are interested and delicious. Their craft beer selection is also a huge selling point. They always have something interesting from sours, porters, stouts and beyond, from local breweries to a variety from around the country there is something for everyone. The ONLY thing we've ever had issues with is sometimes the Nashville Hot chicken sandwich has been overly spicy a few times, to the point where it was almost impossible to eat (and we LOVE spicy food), however, we chalk this up to the fact they use all fresh ingredients in all their menu items and peppers can change in intensity from one batch to the next, as we've had the sandwich before when it was just perfect. They should do a bit more control on that particular sauce, but they do warn you on the menu and the one time we had an overly spicy version they were very apologetic and replaced my husbands order free of charge with a different item. All in all all the other food is incredibly flavorful, and service is good whether you're at a table or at the bar.

3bGFFjG5YJt3xBzIQWIgTA.text: Wow!!!  We ordered 4 different dishes to try out but we really wanted to order the whole menu. We had the fries putton, vermicelli noodles, chicken sandwich and the pork belly bahnmi. Everything was delicious but let me tell you about the chicken sandwich. Just plain AMAZING!!  everything about it was just perfect; it was crispy to the last bite. But it was a light fluffy batter. Not greasy by so much flavor. It wasn't just a pieces of over cooked chicken breast. It was perfection!  Best damn chicken sandwich I've had & what I've  been craving.   We will def be back to eat more of that and try the rest of the menu.

t4k3vUPNd8iqGv_XeqiuuQ.text: Ok ok... all I gotta say is HANGOVER FRIES!!!  Everything is bomb as well. Dem fries tho! Better than animal fries from In-N-OUT. That's right I said it!!! Must check out!!

Tj2n4jx_5K7WVTCjucktkQ.text: We were just in Vegas last weekend and we found this place right by our hotel. We were starving and looking for something quick and good to eat before going out for dinner. We found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. The place is small, but is tastefully decorated and gives off a hipster vibe. They have a lot of local beers to try but we were not familiar with any local breweries so we were happy they had some beer from San Diego that we were familiar with. We both got a Mother Earth brew. We ordered the pork belly banh mi and a small order of wings (I forget which kind we ordered though). The banh mi was great and had some of the best pork belly I've tried. The wings were decent, but very small portion, 4 wings I believe and not good enough to remember what kind we ordered and wouldn't order them again. If you're in town and want a cold beer in a cool little place, this might just be a good place to stop by!

w5-7r86yUw3ZAxDpsbNDyg.text: I've been wanting to come in for a while now and I'm happy I did. Me and my boyfriend went in for a quick bite and to try different beers. The bartender was really welcoming had a lot of suggestions for us on the beer and food. When we went in there all the staff made us feel close.

KE54wXKyGyChCzkN-2UXSA.text: Their menu says Happy Hour EVERYDAY...but we showed up and they then said only Monday through Friday... we would have probably stayed anyway but I don't like False advertising and what a crappy way to get people in there under False pretenses

ViUn-dXkBPALnzto7LHzWw.text: It's Sunday and a beautiful day to have an ice cold beer. We did our typical Yelp and saw this great find. We've seen it before, but this time we took the plunge. Great beers, wonderful and delicious food. We took advantage of their everyday Happy Hour except Saturday and all day when there's a game on Sunday. We enjoyed the fried chicken skins, wings and basically ordered one of everything on the HH menu. Their regular menu had a great selection, folks next to us ordered the Furikake Tuna Burger and said it was excellent. Tristan our lovely bartender, who we affectionally call Jimmy Joe, because my 90 yr old Father in law Bob, who we then called Bobby Joe was hitting on her...lol, she was very friendly and a great sport! It's a great place, lots of fun... a must go to place!

6t_O98qpdjOx8rR-hseXPw.text: "595 Craft and Kitchen" occupies a corner spot within a suburban shopping center. You can find it easily, as you approach the intersection of Rainbow and Tropicana. I would describe this enterprise as a tap house featuring a great selection of craft beers. But what sets it apart from other tap houses are the kitchen offerings. They don't offer generic "pub food".  During my last visit, I tried the "furikake tuna burger" ($14.00). For additional $3.00, I got a small salad. I've had tuna burgers at other restaurants. That said, the taste and texture was very good; the price point, relative to the portion, was fair. As for the salad, it wasn't just chopped lettuce. It was a quality bend of mixed greens, diced tomatoes and sliced cucumber.  The complete menu, along with pricing, is available on their website.  BTW: how did I find this place? I Googled looking for a place in Las Vegas that served "poutine". Yup, they have that--and a lot of other than ordinary bar snacks.

ZUsUSX8JjOFJbxjcU1cIrQ.text: First visit was Amazing the craft burger was delicious, came in the other day had the craft burger for lunch the meat had a funny taste to it, like the meat was old. Not good at all.

MKgRpTcyyMA0dDOMyrOOXA.text: Great rotating craft beers! Very small bar but it's great to stop in and grab a beer you typically can't find at any other local bar. I usually have to go downtown to find beers like this. Very nice to have near home.

3HFDY9XSwRQ2IBw5GN5LMQ.text: literally the best banh mi i've ever had. so much flavor from the meat to the sauce and everything in between!

ubjeUQnRL5irMkelazKW5A.text: My go to gastro pub in my neighborhood. They rotate the taps and the food is excellent.

vImE_LI86myUR5womIZCUA.text: Sometimes don't you just wanna have a cold one after a long day (especially these 100+ days) without the crowd that's poking you with their pool sticks? 595 is perfect!  Indoor and outdoor seating, tons of speciality brews!  We've been here a couple times and the wait staff have always been attentive and friendly!  Both times we let them recommend something for us and it never disappoints! Not to mention, Chef Van whips up some delish finger food that compliments the drinks!  Definitely recommend for just to unwind or to catch the game with some buddies!

al5OaLJ8t4tyTsccyD6Dng.text: Fried devil eggs appetizer-marvelous  Pork belly burger- yummy Tuna burger-done right Poultine(hope I spelled this right)- enough for three people.   We had not been back to this spot since Elements closed. As a upscale sports bar it works well. We will return.

W6pxhotzSn_tBFsUSkSn2A.text: My favorite destination for food and beer. Their Craft burger is hard to beat. The Banh Mis are amazing. And best of all, they always have a great beer list on tap.

PUPs9lEPlKOrGvNs7yfCyg.text: Excellent, fresh tastes.  Burger was fantastic. Beer cheese dip was so good we cleaned out the bowl.  Definitely coming back!

gxJD_5oc4ibbvplejfmiFA.text: Had high hopes when I saw all the different types of poutine on the menu so I stopped in for an early lunch. There was one large group and myself in the restaurant and the only server I saw (for a while at least) was struggling to serve both of us. I asked for a poutine recommendation and he suggested the bad ass chili poutine.  Not really badass and a very unappealing presentation.  Maybe I should have gone for the traditional poutine but still debating if I'll come back and give it a try.

VhsUIrCnwpc1PVjQMM6a9g.text: Pork belly bahn mi and hot fried chicken sandwich. That's all you need to know. Well, also they have awesome craft beer, fast friendly service and you can catch Knights games there without being completely packed like sardines.

RzyEQfhGempgpMPa1QjY9g.text: This may be my new favorite bar in Vegas. There aren't very many hip bars for locals off the strip so this is exactly what I've been in search of. The drinks are creative and there are a TON of local brews and other exciting beers from all over. The Asian fusion bar food was awesome and the vibe here is great. The bartenders are cool and it's a great place to come on a Monday afternoon or a Friday night. The music is low enough that talking is easy and bringing kids here during the day is totally acceptable. Yes, Yes, YES I'll be back!

bGmS6BXlCOVYJX4A3Yl-7g.text: 595 Craft and Kitchen is a kick back and relax, be loud and have fun with your friends while you eat delicious food and drink kraft beers kinda place.  Definitely a place to hit up for happy hour, the unique flavors will keep you coming back.

yKHNL4fZlv1DWvYpoZdzuA.text: Wow! So much better than your typical bar and grill.  Exceptional and tasty menu of fusion foods that are also very homey.  Great music playlist.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JjGfjJHDnb7XKSX9JlT5_Q.text: Went to try out their happy hour menu as our first visit. Sat at the bar with Patrick bartending. Patrick was very nice and knowledgeable about all the beers and food. Had the HH tacos, deep fried deviled eggs and garbage nachos. Everything was good. Will definately return to try out some more items.

UUU0HCaLiKLZad_4c8nCYg.text: Good reprieve from the strip to have a good drink (Large beer on tap selection) and good eats. We split a Cobb salad (super solid) and the nachos which were decent as well. Would definitely recommend.

rfu9ryBB6WJYs8AquvCRTA.text: The food is amazing here. The fried devil eggs and chicken strips are delicious. Place was busy for a Monday night. Service was a little slow and could have better. I would come here again. A+

_qh7v_bB5xVZ4knLRQDB7g.text: Recommended while I was in town by an old friend. Wasn't disappointed in the least. Friendly staff, small seating but quaint and intimate atmosphere. The hangover fries and burger were literally perfect. Would recommend to anyone in the area for locals and for those visiting off the strip. Will come back again and again!!

Vn2raNzvpXJwIVG73Dr75w.text: They have my fav! Blacker the Berry from a local brewer. The food is good. Definitely gourmet bar food.

2vG-0eRIeE5SwAFEgU0uDw.text: If I had this little Gastropub in my town, I'd be a irregular.  The deep fried deviled eggs were a totally new experience and really good. The wings and the sauces were on point. We also tried the crab dip which was fantastic and the poutine. Spring rolls were also fresh and tasty. The place has an outstanding selection of craft beers as well. A great spot to check out among the locals in Las Vegas.

5hLXw6X3DUViLF7qUqh-VQ.text: Seems like a hidden San Diego type brewery with a big selection of craft beers that change constantly. Their chili packs a punch too

p08cATkAyBmjWtSeUdBoHQ.text: I wish they offered beer flights! They have such a big selection of beers and I like to try them all. Be warned if you order the spicy chicken sandwich. I shared this with my boyfriend and so glad I did. I wouldn't have been physically capable of eating the whole thing because it was too spicy! This is coming from someone who loves spicy food. It's like a spicy chicken sandwich from chick fil a times 100. Not kidding.

fYTHw8vHOLOvZ_4dBbuRmw.text: Came here on a Saturday night , it was packed but the waitress was very attentive and walked around checking on me and my boyfriend and once we moved to the bar, the bartender was equally attentive, would bring out of town friends here, plan to try food next time.

xtIygK3qJH1NLySnguzwtQ.text: Super friendly service,  good beer list. Next time, will make sure we are hungry, because food menu sounds great.

gTmkBH6mM2EJYEDK8I_1WQ.text: Great find.  Looked for Castro pubs while in Vegas. Great tap list.  Had the poutine, deep fried deviled eggs, garbage nachos, hangover fries. All were good.  Service was excellent.

CBcIiYzemZmqxD9eneYOnA.text: This is a cool little spot that any local would enjoy, our bartender Bozo was the coolest dude! There is a great selection of local beers and a small menu with great choices. We got the burrata with chutney which the texture was soupy. It was good but I wouldn't order it again. The pork spring rolls were delicious though!

f_7ptGJ_vUJ8VOhyxVp6ag.text: We saw this place passing by and decided to give it a try!! We were not disappointed!!!! Excellent cucumber mescal drinks and the food ... well here goes.   First the fried deviled eggs ...yes they are fried but delicious and amazing and the Sriracha sauce I think I could drink.   The hummus was fantastic you need to try to believe it !!!  Lastly the chicken wings spicy but great flavors you must try !!!   Very reasonable in price and great food. We will be back very soon.  Music is a little loud but nice atmosphere!!!

jdOU3XKD3idOllv7fOYiGQ.text: Absolutely love this place. It's a nice little hidden gem. It's a Small to medium sized restaurant with a fusion of Vietnamese / American bar food?  All I know is it's delicious. Make sure to try one of their Banh Mi sandwiches and fries. They're to die for. Can't say I'm a huge craft beer guy but what I had was good. The service is decent and pretty fast.

BCZKKgsfRzQhOFOZphcV7Q.text: So we always passed by this place but never really checked it out, so today we decided to give this place a try, I am vegan so wasn't sure if they had any vegan options, but hey ! Guess what they did!! I had the brocolini it's a bahn mi sandwich with mushrooms and broccoli and the sauce on the sandwich made it really good ! The sandwich was so fresh! I am definitely visiting this place again. It's got a all American biker vibe to it, which I love !

u7uRBm0-dZauWJbvCXCJxA.text: My boyfriend and I LOVED this place!! It was such a quaint bar, I loved that it had a cooling bar to keep your drinks cold but more than anything we ADORED the bartender bozo!!! He was awesome, he made sure we had everything we needed and even when we were about to head out he managed to convince us to stay an extra 30 minutes

pZ7cMQhorSmwSv5grGwhwA.text: Probably the best place I ate at while in Vegas. I sat at the bar by myself to watch a football game and the bartender was helpful even though he was slammed. Ordered veggie spring rolls and the broccoli Banh mi. The rolls were good, but the sandwich was the star! It was spicy in the best way and paired with hoisin sauce i was in heaven. The bread was toasted to perfection and it felt like a very filling vegetarian sandwich.   Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town!

WiPpYHWsh7kMnerQLmnX7Q.text: One of the few places that none of us had ever been to... the perfect recipe for success. At least this time it was.   I hate deviled eggs. I like theirs. Deep fry anything I think I could at least try it... anything. I took one bite I was like this is yummy, and then I tasted the hard boiled egg, it's the texture really, but I highly recommend it to the deviled egg inclined.  Beer cheese and pretzels. It is hard to screw up a pretzel so, they nailed that. The beer cheese I had low expectations for. Just the perfect amount of beer flavor. Too many times I have had beer cheese that tastes like... just beer, not cheese at all. It was delightful.  Pork belly sandwich. I wish we would have got so much more of this. Delicious, tender belly. Tasty sauce and overall just a stellar experience without much expectation.   THE VERDICT: Go and get yourself some pork belly. The perfect amount of food for three people who weren't very hungry when they went, and it still tickled our stomach to the maximum. No leftovers and nothing was overly expensive. I don't know what the number 595 stands for... but you need it. Believe me. Okay... maybe not need.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried deviled eggs. Beer cheese. Pork belly... well played

61Xolsxqi9M5w1zEOcDQgQ.text: I'm in LV 3-4 days a month for work. I was looking for a spot off of the strip that I can get some good food and chill. I asked yelp for some assistance . "Yelp, who has the best hot wings in LV?"  Yelp replied 595. For me to eat hot wings I need a really good blue cheese dressing. Unfortunately 595 does not have it. Needless to say, I passed on the wings. I did have the burger and fries that hit the spot.  Last but not least, the service. Service was top notch. I looked on the receipt to get her name. Funny, she doesn't look like a Van Alan? Maybe her dad wanted a boy? Anyway, she was awesome and I will be back... Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying apricot beer

9S-BYBKiiQoEBkIPRySIVA.text: Nice appetizers, during happy hour and even better pricing! We popped in to try happy hour before a movie and enjoyed a variety of foods including delicious fried deviled eggs 5/5, crispy chicken skins with a good sauce to dip in 4/5, hand cut house fries 4/5, honey soy chicken bahn mi slider 5/5, signature bahn mi slider 3/5, beer brined chicken wings 3/5 and lastly the Chris' BAD ASS chili 4/5. I would say my favorite things were the fried deviled eggs and the chicken skins, both unique and tasty.  Everything we tried we shared three ways amongst friends. The seating area in 595 Craft and Kitchen was very limited so we were lucky to get in and seated for their Happy Hour (which lasts 3-6 PM and then midnight to close). People around us were trying other items and we all chatted about how good the food was. All of the servers were friendly and very helpful. Enjoy the pics and give this place a try for yourself!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8nD-xzodV3EqJH6idHPNAg.text: I came here to meet up with a friend for Happy Hour. They are located in a pretty busy intersection but fairly easy to find. I walked in and chose my own seat.   Off to one wall is a garage opening style seating area. The parrel side was the actual bar with plenty of beers/cocktail/wines to choose from. I got there with 30mintes left to happy hour. So the guy serving us came back to grab our drink menus and gave us some info on some of the asian fusion food items on the menu.   We both ordered chicken wings; I got the classic buffalo and my friend got the hoisin sauce. They were both equally delicious. I recommend trying the hoisin style wings to change up what youre used to.   Looking at the rest of the menu, they had burgers, banh mi's, and other fusion type items. I wanted to try their banhi mi. I thought it would be too much to eat but OMG it was so good that I had to finish the nearly foot long banh mi sandwhich.   I will definitely return with some friends and maybe even look into their pumpkin carving event! It's such a cool place to hang out--it looks like they even have board games available just to hangout.

FEoNMmELDqEcX2PlfUHwtg.text: What a hidden gem! This place is so cute!! It's also ridiculously clean! First of all, it smells freshly cleaned in here. Like everything has been recently disinfected, but not in a chemical way. Like, if you go in the restroom and look up at the vent fan, it is completely free of dust. I mean, how many times you go into a restroom in a restaurant and the vent fan is caked with nasty dust?? This place is SPOTLESS! And that has to translate to the kitchen. The brisket bahn mi was absolutely delicious. The fries were hot and crisp, the wings are outstanding, literally everything was perfect. Definitely putting this place on our short list - even though we live on the complete other side of vegas.

Ya5aujotvVn6ChDuWYBjgw.text: A group of us had an early dinner around 5pm here yesterday. I called them before going and found out they don't take reservations.  Upon entering, found this place small but hip and chill.   Athough beer is the main attraction, the owners are seeking to establish the gastropub as a family-friendly community hangout. It's great it's a no-smoking and no-gaming place.  The menu is interesting, unique and reasonably priced.  I skipped the variety of beers as I'm not a beer fan. I had their Sparking wine and my bf had their Cocktails called Gordon's Cup that consists of Gin + Cucumber + Mint + Fresh Lime. It was tasty but not strong.  Their craft beers are from all over and they let you sample if you want.  Some of the food ordered were- Garbage Nachos from the Special menu Pork Belly Burger Chicken Skins: breaded, slightly spicy. Pork Belly Bahn Mi: added an egg on it, it's my fave. The pork belly was cooked to perfection and flavorful.  The waitress was attentive and nice.

vYysNhIKiFpevG-NlvSWQw.text: The waitress was so great in the beginning! And then after we spilled a glass of water, we never had our drinks filled, or asked about our food, if we needed anything. We ordered one more beer and that was pretty much it from the server until we closed out. The service was nice throughout, just not very attentive. Food was ok. Concepts sounded better than their execution.

5UyNSMEvZ0OvnnnCUqCMyw.text: The service was spectacular and the buffalo chicken tacos were amazing. We love the selection of not-so-common craft beer on draft. Thank you!!!

j1VVoh-RQUhl5qyJuX-i0A.text: The vibe of this place is amazing. I love the atmosphere, the food was okay, I think I ordered the wrong thing. This is a place to come if you want hang out or catch up with your friends! It's always better to snack with a group of people, especially when you have tea to spill.

IU7LGKCYkTRDoszRWbpzKw.text: Oh. My. God. Why this place is never packed, I'll never understand but I will also never complain. Everything I've had has been superb. Some of the best fries ever. Eat everything on the menu because it is all amazing!

V27PhDP9W5aBijCVHn-Low.text: I met a girlfriend of mine here for happy hour between 3-6pm...made it shortly after. We sat at the bar and I ordered a Lagunitas CherrySour Rain. I am not a big Craft beer drinker but the Lagunitas CherrySour Rain was really really good! The atmosphere was chilled and the bar was pretty full for a Thursday evening. The food menu is like an Asian infused. I had Fried Deviled Egg (who would have thought to fry deviled eggs?). I also had the Fresh Pork Spring Rolls! The food and taste was True to its ethnic origin. Yummy and delicious!! Overall, a fun and chilled neighborhood hidden gem. A must try!

yaomyodBL7Bke225r8xD6Q.text: Excellent gastropub in Spring Valley that isn't obnoxiously loud with patrons drunk on beer. Everything from the food to the service was five stars for me. The gastropub itself isn't too big, so we had one server serve us the entire time. She had a smile on her face the entire time when she attended to us and did so genuinely. Everything from taking our orders promptly, to filling our water cups, to correcting a minor hiccup along the way was spot on. You can tell, this business truly emphasizes excellent customer service.   My boyfriend and I skipped the variety of beers they have on tap because we aren't avid beer drinkers and can't appreciate it. But we did try their burgers and sides.  The badass pork belly burger ($13) was really badass. There were slices of fatty pork belly on top of a burger patty, and cole slaw. I also added a farm egg for $2 extra. The combination was filling and tasty. The red peppers in the cole slaw gave the burger a mild kick and was surprising to the tongue. I added a simple salad as a side for $3 extra. The salad came with mixed greens, carrots, cumcubers, tomatoes, radish and a light citrus vinaigrette.   The chili burger ($12) was chili atop a hamburger patty. Although the chili was tasty, the burger itself was a bit dry. Be prepared to get down and dirty with this burger because it will get messy. A side of fries were added to this order for $3 extra and it came with a side of aioli dipping sauce.   For dessert, we tried the Reese's bread pudding. Save room for dessert because this decadent peanut butter and chocolate dish is too good to skip. Sticks of bread are stacked atop one another and served with a side of sweet whipped cream and crumbs. The portion is pretty hefty too and can serve up to 4 people!  I will definitely be coming back to try all the other dishes 595 has to offer. This place is truly a gem.

Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Badass chili burger with farm egg and side fries  (front) and crispy pork belly with farm egg and side salad (back)

_Iv7n6iietCSKH3_oLtS8Q.text: Great find! Love the San Diego Beer styles and this is one of the few that tap those awesome breweries. Along with our great local brews too. I had driven by this place and thought it was a William Sonoma type store and decided to stop by and look for grilling utensils and found BEER!  Food is an Asian Fusion and so far it has been outstanding. They also serve Poutine- and a very good one at that. Garbage Nachos and the pork belly Banh Mi is delicious. Deep fried deviled eggs are great version of scotch eggs. Modern Bar with a brewery tasting room vibe and includes a frost rail on bar to help keep the glass cold- although I'm not sure how much it actually helps but looks cool! Look forward to many return trips.

0xDQVGTnldmlr3C8GeEn6A.text: I came in here the other day on a whim. Dude. Amazing food, awesome selection of craft beer, and super nice staff. Whoever set the menu at this place has awesome taste. The food is so good!  I wasn't surprised when I went to leave this review and saw the place had a solid 4.5 star rating. I wish this place was closer to where I live. I definitely recommend!!!

jiqcU-PutCo39wUY9VU9ug.text: This place is a good fusion pub. We started the night off with Crispy Chicken Skins with a side of sweet chili sauce. The chicken skins were warm and freshly fried and lightly seasoned with salt, green onions, and a dusting of chili powder. The chicken skins were slightly spicy, giving it a good kick and unique flavor from regular chicken skin. For the main course, I had the Pork Belly Bahn Mi. The pork belly was cooked to perfection, with the fat rendered and the meat being very tender. The pickled cucumber and carrots accentuated the flavors of the pork and were not too sour.  This is a great place to catch up with friends and grab a quick bite to eat.

pUksXSzvLYN9AFjECJks5A.text: Happened by this place by chance, and I was happy that I did. Solid craft beer list. Bahn Mi with pork belly was very good, though I admittedly haven't had many of this type of sandwich. My friend ordered the hot fried chicken sandwich and was very pleased with it - it was actually hot (spicy). Fries were well above average.

zYA14y0mbaByLdESnWauww.text: My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday afternoon to have some beers and to share appetizers. The beer selection was amazing. Our server gave us many suggestions based on the types of beers we liked and didn't hesitate to give us a sample for anything we were unsure of. We were very pleased with our beer choices.  We ordered the Beer Cheese with pretzel bites to go along with our brews. The beer cheese was not very flavorful, but the pretzels were really fresh and tasty. We also ordered the Beer Brined Chicken Wings (buffalo flavor) which came with pickled veggies. The wings were amazing, but the pickled veggies were not great. Lastly, we ordered Chris' Bad Ass Chili Poutine. We loved it! The chili was delicious and packed with flavor. I would definitely like to come back and explore other items on their menu.

oEebJQgNigZprHhuh__21g.text: The food is okay. Nothing too spectacular. The hot chicken sandwich has no flavor and the breading just falls off. What really kept me coming back for so long was the service, now that the best bartender is gone, I don't think I shall be returning.

HxbtF3QmDmSNWyc3_JRjMw.text: I'm a little hesitant to write a review, as I want to keep this place all to myself! Some friends and I went here last night for dinner and drinks and will most certainly being going back soon. It was packed when we arrived. It's open seating, so we found a little shelf rail bar to sit at in the back. The wait staff was prompt, friendly and knowledgeable. They have a great selection of very tasty beers. The food was top notch. I ordered the heirloom tomato salad with added (seared) tuna. Best. Decision. Ever. I highly recommend it. They don't have freezers so everything they make is fresh. Their pricing reflects this, but it is still worth it.

rikMrffoeulDK01TYRTXIA.text: Went here for lunch and the food is good. The banh mi sandwiches were pretty tasty and the deep fried deviled eggs were buttery soft. Can't wait to try out more of the menu items!

UkJrcw08WMJa0o9EOFAWLw.text: This is the kind of place Las Vegas needs! Phenomenal food, awesome beer selection, attention to detail, and welcoming. I'm a liquor executive and I know food and beverage on a professional & personal level. This is a gem! Good job Van-Alan & Chris!  Your loyal customer! Damien with 1855 Distributors.

mEQpTubE2BaBq85cqFPDlg.text: Pretty cool gastropub! We ordered the fried deviled eggs and the Thai Spicy Hummus. I personally preferred the deviled eggs. 595 had a real nice selection of beer on tap and bottles. PtPt7Ap8VjKEAlsFJccDVA.text: I first noticed this place when they were under construction when I stopped in to eat at Meraki next door(definitely recommend if you want Greek food.) Then I started following their remodel updates. Van and the staff really create a great atmosphere if you want a bar that's actually a bar. I will be going here regularly.

qtEvSSLc8tRH3TBbb41E5g.text: I was not expecting to find such an outstanding Asian Fusion place in Vegas. The Banh Mi Sandwich was outstanding! The portion looked small, but it's excellent quality and I was full when I was done. I am  now disappointed in myself for leaving Vegas too early because I cannot go back.

37-o6MWgGAmbrxjlYUOXug.text: Very good food place.  Food is very good and a bit different from other places.  The beer selection is extensive.  Service was solid.  I'll definitely be back!

GELqz3t0iPud14UvPBEYNA.text: Great atmosphere, fantastic food, solid beer selection and friendly staff! You always find better places to eat outside the strip.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town.

_OWt-6wVm7D-SaNcbCTzeA.text: Great place! Craft beers listed on the boards are excellent. Good variety of beer. Good happy hour. The staff is very friendly. Food is good. Try the fries.

mO55gZ1h32RQuHGfdIxspQ.text: I love Tristen. She is just a wonderful waitress. The astomphere is wonderful and accommodating for all walks of life

VsbGAIqAeALH_nRfpGrUsg.text: I give 4 stars for the food. I love the craft burger. I add the egg and bacon. The crab dip is good too but this time it had chunks of meat instead of shredded crab meat. Got fried chicken skin and it was awesome. I could eat that as my meal alone. BUT both times I've been there, our order has come out wrong: missing egg or bacon or fries or the wrong dish was brought out.  Overall, I can get over the ordering issues since they'll fix it and I really enjoy the food.

K9aO9mObRJrqfXL2rX-MmA.text: Phenomenal service, amazing drinks, delicious food all made in house from scratch! The ambience was wonderful!

g3ZS7prpKGtbEcPlI_m5NQ.text: I really like their take on Vietnamese sandwiches!  Lots of good bar food and then some!  One of my favorite lunch spots in Vegas.

9HiOhzL62buG0tN0qx3G0g.text: We had a group of 14 and really enjoyed the food and service at 595 Craft Kitchen. The staff were friendly. The food was delicious. We had salads, chili, bahn mi, popcorn, fries, and a few other items. Would definitely go back. And the price was reasonable. It's a small venue which also made the experience intimate. The only thing was their beer menu was on the board only where as the cocktail menu was on paper. The one on the board was a little hard to see with my old eyes.

1VESC6wvwehLsGCYU2Boiw.text: I love this place so much! if you like beer - this is the right place for you. They have rotating handles, the best selections of craft beers. I used to only like to drink Bud Light (lame, I know), but after coming to 595, I've really gotten to experience a variety of different beers. I've come to find that I really enjoy sours - something I wouldn't have known had I not gotten the opportunity to try different beers. Also, their food is delicious! The chili cheese fries and Vermicelli noodle salad are to die for. Check this place out - you won't be disappointed.

eGOfDkRzcAdxEGmAxJeCNg.text: Great find!!!  Just open recently.  I gave it 4 star due to service- which was slow in the beginning but did get better.    But food didn't disappoint!!!  We ordered the butcher block burger with bacon and egg- moist and tasty.  The crab dip is the best dish we got- right spice and has lumps of crabs.  The deep fried deviled egg was very good with Tye sauce it came in with.  I'm not a big fan of poutine- but the beer cheese was good.   We were not able to try the mix drinks and crafts BUT definitely coming back to try it.

CA7slhU8dPzo_MT7gV9q4g.text: Excellent food and drinks !!! Customer service on point!!!! Will come back !!!! Lots of choices for beer. Clean and modern atmosphere. Overall a wonderful experience

i4EnOAbjPxuu1UD-VnDe-Q.text: I have been to this place a few times now and can confidently leave this review. The cleanliness of this place is what you notice right away. The second thing is that they have a great selection of craft beer. The third thing is the food choices. All I can say is get the Loco Moco Poutine with the hamburger patty. This has me coming back again and again. Thanks for the great service and selections.

IdN6W_sjzH3qoPdwF2l38Q.text: I wish I could give 3.5 stars....  595 was highly anticipated and much needed in the area. The menu is great and the food is delicious. This is a fantastic place to enjoy craft beers and they are very supportive of local breweries. They also regularly host the local beer community for bottle shares and special events.  The reason they don't get 4 stars or more from me (yet) is because of the service. The 1st time I was in there was for a bottle share, which had been planned pretty far in advance. The server who was scheduled to work that day had apparently called in (which is no fault of the restaurants, that stuff happens). In a pinch, they had the wife (I think) of the Manager fill in. It didn't go so well, unfortunately. She wasn't familiar with the beers and we ended up with not 1, but 2 issues with our bill. She charged us for someone elses tab.  Anyhow, it wasn't a major deal breaker - I would still consider them a new place with some kinks to work out, but overall it's a great vibe and we need more places like this in town. Definitely check it out if you get a chance.

qtu0Ip1ez3VPNUjUdi-9mA.text: Awesome food! Great selection of beer! The owner Van is super cool and personable! Make sure you stop here when you're in Vegas

vqd8HPMY_j0mp8LbLTSqFg.text: Staying town for business... stumbled on it by accident. Super chill and relaxed atmosphere, service was really fast, prices are great, and the staff is super down to earth. I wish I had a place like this local for me. DEFINITELY on my list to hit up when I come to Vegas from now on. Definitely glad I found it.

tw2PTnQfc_KYLlkUEEYk1A.text: Friendly staff and nice beer selection. Food is tasty as well. Spicy chicken sandwich is really spicy!!! Beer cheese and tuna burger are good. Will come back!

PfYOO3_WLaJJ-wtVksmKWA.text: My hubby and I came here for a quick bite and drink and totally enjoyed ourselves. Tonnes of on tap craft beer options; we chose the Modern Times and were surprised with the tartness of it. But fresh and good for our early afternoon drink. The food menu offered many tasty delights; chopped cabbage salad, veggie summer spring rolls, Bahn mi sandwiches, garbage nachos; but we came for one thing, the poutine. I'm Canadian and needed my fix. They nailed it, yummy, homemade brown gravy, thick cheese curds, scallions and added fried egg. Good and salty, crispy fries. Hit the spot. Great and friendly service, Val was awesome. Loved the music they had on very inviting space. Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W9VM3yaSWM6cJnpxmuKFgQ.text: Cool late night hang out spot! 595 Craft and Kitchen is located right behind Walgreens on Rainbow and Trop.   They got an awesome selection of beers. I would come back just for this reason...seems their selection changes often so looking forward to their next rotation.   Food was hit or miss....  Deviled egg: recommended appetizer which turned out to be the highlight. Fried egg white with creamy/paste-like egg yolk on top. Came with a dipping sauce. This is one of those simple but great appetizer.   Furikake tuna burger: tuna was seared and perfectly cooked. I liked how the sauce had a hint of spice, but wish they sprinkled more furikake or offered extra furikake on the side. This was one of my favorite.  Chicken sandwich: sadly no bueno. Chicken was waaaay to greasy and there was aftertaste of old oil or grease that lingered in my mouth.   Loco moco poutine: Choose spam, came with 3 slices. Egg was cooked perfectly with runny yolk. Fries were not too crispy as it was covered in gravy that instantly turned all the fries soggy. Gravy itself was mediocre and not my favorite.   I'd come back here to drink. Great service but food was hit or miss. 4 out of 5 I would recommend!

PlyDa0C7f28BKcMOgmfw8w.text: Food was really good.  My friend got the sandwich special that was pastrami with a salad.  I got the tuna, cooked a perfect med. rare with a salad and house made dressing.  Service was non existent! After being told to sit anywhere in the small dining room we than proceeded to wait almost 10 minutes to just get our drinks.  Than she finally took our orders.  Food did not take that long to get to our table.  However we sat there and never once was checked back on, got refills or even our check.  The other tables in the dining room were constantly looking around for the blonde bartender/server as well.  During this time she was constantly at the bar talking to some guy she apparently knew.  He did not even appear to be customer.  I finally just left some cash on the table hoping it was enough to cover our tab and left.  It is great that they have lunch specials but most of us that go out to eat for lunch during the week are on break from work and don't get an unlimited amount of time away from our jobs.

4K9p42iMcmsZpVCGIqB6EA.text: Beer list is outstanding! The food is always delicious. IMO hot chicken is phenomenal especially if you like spice!!!! Best I've ever had

E7mVz5awkCP6wQ-hZF2fQw.text: Fried Devil Eggs are off the charts. Great place. Great staff. Really good food and great beer selection.

Vd8Wn4Xc_l8kWDQT2nrJVA.text: The food was absolutely delicious! This was my first time trying a banh mi and I'm hooked! The hangover fries were so good. Service was very friendly. Recommend anyone to head on over and give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Bang mi with hangover fries

3kjUAI2Zn21XXmLnjmM7fg.text: Strong drinks and bitchin' food!!!!!!!!!!!! The cashew hummus and buffalo wings was the varsity first stringers. Second string on food was the spring rolls and the tequila lime popcorn. Just wowza. Love the cool and random diversified menu. Very awesome little gastropub. We loved our cocktails and would definitely be back.  ALTHOUGH! My friends did not like their crab dip and burrata/ginger chutney dips. They said the crab dip resembled a kind of Japanese-lasagna type dish with tortilla chips? And the burrata and chutney dip was like just warm burrata in a wok with no chutney. But our food was so good otherwise we didn't care.  Gr8 for Vegans!

PL6aDcqlJWfhrjkNaB-gRw.text: Yum. The food was so tasty and decently priced. It is pretty small inside but the service and the beer are both amazing. The happy hour is a good real too with discounts on beer and cocktails...and 5$/10$ food specials. I'm glad I tried it I'll definitely be back in!
