ky-NbvKds7BsSzrx_emmfw.text: I love this place. In Vegas 4-6 times a year and always end up here. Very good selection of beer and wings are stupid good...any flavor. It has a cool, relaxed local feel and all are welcome. There's a number of places with similar profiles / philosophies but no one pulls it off like 565!

-P32sjiTBPpnjDWzgAq8qg.text: This is my go-to spot when I want a laid back atmosphere, great drinks, and even better food. I've never tried anything there that I didn't like. As far as drinks go, I'm not much of a beer lover (I know, I know. They're known for their wide beer selection), but I've had good ciders and great cocktails there. My personal favorites are the Daiquiri and one of their specialty cocktail's Queen Bee. When it comes to food, it's always mouthwatering. I can't stop in and not order their beer cheese with pretzels. I've tried the beer cheese at other restaurants, and 595's is, without a doubt, my favorite. They also make amazing chicken wings, and an even better Bahn Mi "burger." GAME CHANGER. I'm telling you. And if you're looking for something spicy, and I mean really spicy, try the Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich. They aren't kidding when they say spicy - you have been warned! They also have games you can play at your table, which is fun and different for a bar/restaurant. I really enjoy the vibe in here; a lot of Vegas bars can either lean too far into college territory, or they have slots and cater to an older crowd. It feels cool and young, without trying too hard. One of my favorite spots in Vegas as a local.

i5P-Tl49tBPIDEiJ2s4ECA.text: This place really surprised me. It's in a strip mall next to a Walgreens and a Cheveron but it really is a gem! When you walk in, it kind of has a California vibe the bar has a few chalk boards with all the beers on tab. My boyfriend ordered the "New IPA who dis" by Joseph James he said it was good.   We shared the FRIED DEVILED EGGS 5/5 on those. They are beer battered and fried to perfection! The spicy aioli it comes with is delicious too!  We also shared the PORK BELLY BUHN MI 5/5 sooo good! The pork belly is seasoned so well and melts in your mouth and the fresh veggies in the bun are crispy.   I ordered the Gordon Gin, it was very well mixed. Not too heavy on the lemon and a good taste of gin and mint. I'd come back for this cocktail alone.   We were really impressed!

t0avXQLUcy9ZOJPuNBIIQA.text: First time eating at this place good selection of beer chicken sandwich amazing & pork tacos out of this world the bartender amazing great service this place should be at the Strip thanks sincerely Alexander L

bOqwy0y-oqKwa9oi-UiADg.text: Came here on a first date. Great environment to chat and get to know someone. Food was delicious and perfect portion sizes to share. Had a good beer that I wouldn't have normally tried. I'll definitely return for more fries with different toppings. :-) hopefully on a second date!

28lnAm80u5Nuxnk6759NGA.text: Visited here from Dallas and let me say, no regrets whatsoever. Javier, the bartender, and Phan the owner were awesome. Incredibly knowledgeable about the menu, beer and cocktails/liquor. The hummus was absolutely amazing. We also got the hot chicken sandwich and pork belly burger and both items had such intense, wonderful flavors. If you're looking for a 'regulars' and 'locals' kind of spot this is your go-to.

cWV1aC5FiZgL0qNBsNYVIA.text: First time at  595 Craft & Kitchen. Outstanding Banh Mi Sandwich as well as Craft Beer. Craft Beer Haven , Some Brews I' ve never heard of. Outstanding Selection. Will be back again.  Highly Recommend ........

W2maM9AUN-COtCyc0SEUlQ.text: I went about midnight on a Friday very chilled place the owners where there very chill people from cali I believe. I had the poutine, burgers, and hummus, all really tasty Asian flavors to everything, alot of good beers and Japanese whisky. They close at 2 we were there well pass and they didn't hassle us or anything. Very cool place to check out. Oh and they have like a nitro type strip on the bar to keep your beer cold. I'm probably describing it wrong. But check this place out for sure

zQxceT0gz_OnSRUWTuyV2w.text: A friend suggested meet for lunch and mentioned 595 Craft and Kitchen. After checking out the excellent yelp reviews and noticing they have a nice selection of craft beers on tap, we agreed to meet her there. Located in a strip mall, lots of parking, seating at the bar, tables or high tops. Our server, Tristan, was very friendly and knowledgeable, explaining that all the food dishes were prepared fresh only after the customer orders since everything the kitchen prepares is ordered daily. We ordered two Pork Belly Bahn Mi sandwiches, a Chicken Bahn Mi and Veggie Spring Rolls-everything was flavorful, fresh and very tasty! I asked Tristan for some beer suggestions and she sold me on the Occidental Dunkel, which was very nice with lunch-smooth and perfect with my Pork Belly Bahn Mi! They also had Coca-Cola products which is a definite plus with my wife, who must have a Coke with her meals! Looking forward to going again and checking out more of their food and beers!

x2FCSDIl7fgFdvgjumohEQ.text: Awesome bar, the food is delicious. My husband and I come often and enjoy it every time. The owner and staff are super cool !!

e9VpU4JiY3bzEEaC73n4Ow.text: This is my first time here and i will be back. It reminds me San Diego or San Francisco. This is an awesome craft bar. There are so many options of beer in tap. It's bar food elevated.

DGyT5oEE2dCV3rZ-An4A_A.text: The food here is delicious and the restaurant is small and cozy! I really enjoyed this bar with their craft beers and unique cocktails. The food had a great spice, and the bread pudding was TO DIE FOR. I am one who avoids desert and eats healthy but every bite of that Nutella bread pudding was worth the calories.

V6yaBXc2D48mMgomvOqlhg.text: Rotating craft beer on tap with local support and a friendly attentive staff is enough to give this place five stars. 595, however, goes above and beyond with a talented chef and diverse menu. All the favorites have just enough spin to make it taste like their own, but will not alienate the average customer. Looking forward to tasting all the offerings. I have yet to be disappointed. CHEERS!

p3jHaH_aW8PbILERnDJ_bQ.text: This place is awesome! Mark the bartender took very good care of us! Amazing service and great knowledge of beer! Amazing beers! Great food! Perfect environment for just hanging out or going to get sloshy while watching football! Recommend coming here Forsure! Will be a regular from now on!

7dS-6YrKBsXt6cbHQDCYxw.text: Amazing ambiance and delicious food. The mood is perfect for locals or for out of town guests in the know. This place has flavors you won't find in many places and they're willing to take risks in both their food and their beer selection which includes some hard to find or impossible to find brews. Definitely recommend for anyone looking to get off the strip, reset, and enjoy a real dinner with unexpected flavors.

38YyAvtEKhXyaqO4vtaYTQ.text: I have been coming into this bar now for a little over a year now. The food is pretty decent and the atmosphere has always been really awesome, especially when the Knights are playing.. Mostly because of the bartenders and their witty banter with the guests at the bar.  I went in for the playoff game and immediately asked for my favorite bar tender, Tristian (who usually works on Wednesday's) and was told that she is no longer with the company.. To be honest, she is the kind of person who makes all experiences memorable, all bad days better and all heavy days lighter. Isn't that why most regulars frequent places such as these? Yes. And that is why 595 became my regular dwelling place.. Now that this special soul is gone, I can't imagine myself coming back here. It feels empty and lifeless.  When you find employees who have such an impact on their patrons, one should be mindful and keep them around. She touched my life and I know she touched others in an extremely positive way.  595 will never be the same in my opinion.

jNXnmvT7z8Pf_tiFYQYq8A.text: Ive been in here a couple times and the food is excellent, servers are friendly, and it's nice to try new beers. The decor is very good too, just an all around good place.

G1b014sDb_XeaK4yDRiwhQ.text: Found this place on yelp, looked like the perfect spot to hang out and get some grub after a concert.  The food menu looked great and had some great beers from our home town San Diego.  It turned out to be a great night, good/fun music, great service, delicious food and good selection of drinks.  There were 8 of us in the party and we each ordered something different, but everyone was happy.   Will come back for sure, next time we are in town.

Evknf4DCW1Q1d3Xv7JaXjA.text: Loved everything about it. We ordered the fried chicken skins and the marinated olives for appetizers, both of which were delicious. -xy6NB_cKVtsrOa1AIExGA.text: The fries are amazing and their selection of beer is bomb! It's a bit small but a great little place to stop for a bite to eat with friends! They also have a lunch deal, if you order a burger or their banh mi sandwich you get a side for free :)

TNA-jtyZdU75X1inH20Ctw.text: I'm surprised by the other reviews bashing the service, my server was polite and available the entire time I was there. She checked on us regularly and even joked about food comas when we asked for the check.   I went to get lunch with a friend during their happy hour. The appetizers were cheap but the portions were large for the most part. I ordered the pork tacos which were rather simple in my opinion  along with a set of the garbage nachos which were definitely loaded, I had to power through to finish them.  My friend ordered wings, chili fries and the unbelievably delicious deviled eggs which she had to take home due to, again, the large serving sizes. The eggs were breaded and baked, I've never seen that done before.  If you want alcohol I recommend trying their beers only because the daiquiri I ordered was outrageously small- it came served in a tiny snifter glass I picked up with two fingers.

This is definitely a must go for anyone who loves beer, good food and great vibes.   The loco moco poutine fries are definitely a must try. The portion is size is more than plenty to share. meR6qdmSGP8eZv7Gd_V_cQ.text: I didn't like 595 from the get go but it wasn't their fault.   When I used to work in this plaza I used to get food to go from the place that occupied this spot before and honestly it was always such a negative experience that it carried over to 595. The banh mi was my bodega sandwich growing up and to see it become the trendy butchered flavor of the month, I was eager to judge. I thought "$10 for a banh mi?!" and honestly probably couldn't get past my ego to give it a fair taste.   Fast forward a few years and a lot of humbling I was blown away by the same sandwich I once thought "this ain't it chief". The thing is though, 595 isn't just about that one sandwich, its about its dozens of killer food options (garbage fries umphh), the extensive deep craft beer list AND most importantly how it has chosen to integrate itself into the community. Imagine how easy it is to be another spot that just mindlessly rides on the craft beer wave without the ounce of passion that 595 puts in? Sorry for counting you guys out.   Check out their beer list on their website, the mini bottle shop, their Instagram for beer and sports events, and their $10 lunch specials (I recommend the pork belly banh mi of course).

LCIoWcvauC9-pV3T5mqBzQ.text: Came here last night a little worried that I had a big group and we were going to have to wait a while to be seated, just based on other restaurants when you go in with big parties. Well, I walked in, said I had a group of 12-14 people coming, and Van accommodated is IMMEDIATELY. Put some tables together and made it work out perfectly. I was super happy about this. Drinks and food were awesome. I had the hot fried chicken sandwich and a few house beers. I literally have zero complaints. Definitely coming back here even for a drink after work. Happens to be so conveniently on my way home. Thanks again guys! You've gained a loyal customer. :)

ZQ8UpgSSnROCPmy9vyQPgw.text: Visiting from Arizona, my friends and I stumbled upon this place. I loved the beer selection, the staff is friendly and made our visit enjoyable. The food is amazing. I wish I lived closer so I could visit regularly!

dE0zmHJq03ysVpEwNWPjfg.text: Stopped by on a hot day for a burger and a drink. Everything was good. Service was very friendly and if you enjoy old school rock this is a place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2tH0hMuIBKfstLF2F8IVnA.text: Quite a gem... delicious, Vietnamese-inspired takes on food.  My workmates and I stopped in for lunch and 595 Craft scored 4/4.  We enjoyed the Vermicelli Noodle Salad, Spring Rolls, a Butcher Block Craft Burger and the Beer Cheese Poutine.  Each dish had a twist that made it noteworthy.  Our server was great!  He made informed recommendations that added to our meal.  We'll definitely be back for more food and to try out some of the local craft beers.

MDjCK6ajuErCr9BVmbw0HA.text: My wife and I decided to try a new place to get a burger near our home. Our server was very nice and attentive. We both ordered our burgers medium well however they came medium rare. My wife's french fries were cold and my poutine fries had a gravy that was sweet tasting. Once was enough for us we won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZyNRcZpt5fd1yOFA5uTiIQ.text: Super awesome find on yelp away from the tourists and hanging with the locals.  The burrata salad was amazing with pork!  They have an awesome craft beer selection from San Diego. Owner is from there and these are legit, small micro breweries!!!

Qf-ilKQq7K27ZoMheSPHlQ.text: Visiting vegas and decided to stop here prior to checking in...deviled eggs were very good...tuna buger was good, but lacking a little flavor...poutine fries were probably one of the worst ever experienced...fries were hard as rocks and dried out...not even the sauce could help...bland as well...a decent beer selection on draft was a plus...

9dt6hggaXO3Dtd4m-F2AeQ.text: Modern small little gastropub, pretty friendly service - we just sat wherever we liked. They have a good selection of beers, a little pricy but ok. I read some yelp reviews that claimed the food was a bit salty and I would have to agree. We got the crispy fried deviled eggs which were very crisp, unfortunately they were fairly standard and came with a sauce that wasn't really necessary in my opinion. The hot fried chicken sandwich was pretty hot for me but had great flavor - just would have loved some pickled vegetables on the side or some sort of slaw to cool everything down. The loco moco poutine was good with spam but it was way too salty. Gravy flavor was excellent though.  I will admit we could have ordered a little better and had a more balanced meal - that being said the loco moco all by itself with spam was very salty.  Overall not bad. 3.75/5.

hejvlhyIIH6cK4D6vZHPtw.text: Great beer and food selection!  But a bit pricey.  Three beers each, one garbage nachos, one sandwich including tip $82 dollars.  ouch!

ljypqPQER7JiYjHiLhgGIA.text: Ive been looking for new places to eat ever since I visited Vegas a couple months ago and went for a crazy one day and a half stay before I had to go back to work but of course the trusty yelp led me to this place. Besides the sweltering daily humid heat of vegas this restaurant was nice and modern. The server was great and nice and she offered me suggestions of whats good. So I ended up getting the pork belly burger and accompanied it with a Belgian sour cherry beer for the drink. The pickled slaw they had on the pork belly and the sauce went pretty well with each other and the fries were crispy. I loved the Belgian sour cherry beer I got and everything from start to finish was great. This place definitely didn't disappoint and it was like a tall glass of shade in this desert heat. Being checked upon if everything was great led to some great service even though their were only a couple people there but mostly at the bar. Itll be one of my go to's when I visit vegas again so I can have a pork belly burger again and try another beer as well. Thanks guys

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZzBL_uXJpZVHT6LQRCQJQ.text: Who needs a side of fries when you have fried chicken skins!  The chicken skins probably didn't help my cholesterol...but I couldn't stop eating them.  A very large portion, each bite perfectly crispy and seasoned (salty with a slight kick).  The batter is light and crunchy and paired with a sweet chili sauce.  This was definitely a great side to my furikake tuna burger.  The tuna burger was quite possibly just slightly under seasoned for my taste but seared perfectly.  To clarify, one review scared me when they mentioned ground tuna....the tuna was a seared tuna steak cut into slices...no ground tuna here.  I thought the garlic aioli, arugula, heirloom tomatoes, and shitake mushrooms were a perfect pairing for the tuna.   I might see if they can turn this into a salad for me next time, the bun was a little underwhelming.  The chicken skins were so good, I wanted to shove them inside my tuna burger....  My husband got the loco moco poutine, opting for the hamburger patty.  I sampled a fry with the gravy and the gravy was on point.  I saw they have a brunch menu on the weekends with some good options.  We will definitely be back.  I kept talking about the chicken skins all weekend....please get them!  It's a bar but we also saw some kids eating here, they have a separate dining section.  Limited table seating, mostly bar tables...so might not be the best with lots of little kids.  We did note they have at least one high chair.  The one down side, don't come here if your looking for a "quick" bite.  The food took quite some time to come out of the kitchen, and we were there on a slow night.

fui7nasgtElSx520yq1NEQ.text: 595 Craft and Kitchen is a great hang out spot to enjoy a drink (or two) while indulging in their tasty food. Not only does this place have a variety of craft beers/cocktails/wine to choose from, but they also have amazing food with an Asian twist. This is the second time I've been here and I have to say that this place has always been consistent with excellent service and yummy food. My friends and I came here this afternoon for their happy hour and were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice and allowed us to sample the craft beers before making a decision. My friends and I ended up ordering the Mango Hefeweizen and it was pretty good. From the happy hour menu, we ordered the Thai cashew hummus, Garbage Nachos, and the Fried Deviled Eggs to share. The food came out fast and we found everything to be delicious. In addition, I ordered a signature banh mi sandwich with a side of Hangover fries to-go for my boyfriend to bring back home and he loved it! I definitely recommend this place. I guarantee you won't be disappointed.

YShOwF7OtUAS-gYJ_3rdFQ.text: WOW! Had dinner here recently on date night and we were both very pleased. We got hot crab dip as an appetizer and it was awesome! Pita bread & fresh chips to go with were also great! We both ended up with the pork belly burger. My bf wanted to remove the extra cabbage slaw but I insisted to eat it the way it comes ( how the chef/cooks invisioned it!) so he agreed and was very happy! We both were! What a damn good burger. I had a well drink he ordered a signature cocktail and both were delicious. My bfs was a bit strong (to him) but I thought it was just strong enough. There were also tons of beers to choose from, including on tap. Music was lively and loud and it wasn't too crowded inside but was busy. We recommended this place and the pork belly burger to everyone the following days it was so delicious!  .   Our waiter was also very nice, he talked with us a bit and was quick with our food & drinks . Also had some good recommendations.    All in all the place was great! We will be back and with friends ! Awesome job to everyone @595 Craft & Kitchen

rgMD1pdwHZGag0QGLvnupA.text: Service, food, and beers were great!  The garbage fries were amazingly delicious!!  The pork belly banh mi with an over medium egg also delicious!  The chili also was good tasting.  Burgers were good - just wished they were not well done, ruins it - leaving it with really no flavor.  The vermicelli noodle salad with the brisket was good too but needed that...umami flavor???...like it needed that fish sauce and it would have been perfect!  That hot fried chicken sandwich was...HOT (as described on the menu)!!  Like it was too hot that you really can't enjoy the sandwich.  And I can love spicy food - like on a scale of 1 to 10 with a Thai Chili...usually a 7 or 8.  This was like a 12.  After scraping the breading off the chicken, the sandwich was still pretty good.  Craft beer selection was good too!  I had a Lovelady Mojito Sour and it was delicious!  The place is a bit small so large parties of 8 or more might have to wait for tables.

ApcyisBrpo_yyQ05nR9PdA.text: I came here for happy hour awhile back. It's super intimate as the space isn't huge but it's got such a great vibe to it. Love that it's around the corner from me. The food was super yummy, and the selection of beers is great. I look forward to coming back and trying out some other things on the menu.

Tv7BcMQ8e8zlicYaBIt8Rg.text: Great burgers, great beers, great poutine, great bahn mi- how often can you say that?! This place has a relaxed, comfortable vibe plus an awesome playlist.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Fync1SSRj5guLrUpc7FHCA.text: We've been super excited for this place to open up as we were big fans of the original Elements that was at this location. The Mr. and I decided to check it out on a Friday. We seated ourselves at the bar where we ran into some old friends. We're not beer drinkers (I know blasphemy) so I had a Powderfinger and he had an After the Gold Rush. Both were very good, but nothing that knocked my socks  next we ordered the chicken skins and the poutine with porkbelly. Both dishes were amazing! The chicken skins were the best I've had and the pork belly was perfect. The only bummer is that the Mr wanted a Sailor Jerry  and Diet Coke for a second round. The bar only carries a white and a dark, but no spiced rum. J isn't picky so he settled for just a white rum.   All in all it seems like this will be a great neighborhood place that I look forward to visiting again. I know it's a beer focused place, but it'd be nice to see a more fleshed out cocktail menu, maybe some mead (please!), and a larger selection of alcohol in general.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tAIpPpGLikxcjq5Xvh1JIw.text: Loved it!  In town for work.  Wanted a bite and a beer.  Both were awesome.  Frequently changing taps and great food.  I had one of the bahn mi sandwiches and two tasty IPAs.  Definitely going to visit again.

RnRmOkxWyWeuteLwVboT1A.text: Great small place, great vibe to the place, the popcorn was not that fresh but the Hammus cashew was amazing

vAGt-iRu5ym5KlKUgOw7fA.text: GO HERE. THE BAHN MI SANDWICH WILL BLOW YOUR MIND.    Oh yeah...btw, the beer list, atmosphere, and friendly staff will equally blow your mind!

mINnHItKeeJDOQWiXo8KCA.text: I came here with my brother in laws on a Tuesday night.  We're chill environment and they were playing reggae - a great thing.  We tried different beers on tap and ended up ordering the garbage nachos - real good and it was enough to share amongst 3 of us.  We will definitely be back.

c9u_tFCM_DKU1Jx5tkiT0g.text: This side of town really needs a gastro pub like this. It has so much potential with a great menu, creative ingredients...however that is not enough. The bartenders on two different shifts I watched them ignore multiple customers, including myself. With their cold, dismissive personalities I never want to come back here again.

092qDx5FUSLeaNgrlKOn7w.text: Ate here with a group and had the deviled eggs, pretzels and cheese, wings and crab dip. Everything was AMAZING! I had the chicken sandwich for dinner and it was perfectly cooked with the perfect amount of spice. To top things off I had the blue eden which was easily the best drink of the day. Highly recommend going here if you're looking for a place off the strip!

-JCLHuXZV2eYAeD_Kf5V9A.text: I've been here a few times and each time has been excellent. The staff was super friendly and even remembered my name when I came back. The drink selection is great (Cali Creamin on Nitro FTW!) and the food is great. The burrata and heirloom tomato salad is by far the best I've ever had. The chili is also really good. I love the interior and the stack of games are a nice touch. I'll definitely be coming here regularly.

k6UOHjTDfXrKCGcuAjbeKQ.text: Truly unique experience in Las Vegas! Van the owner is awesome and the staff gives great service. Great selection of craft beers and food is top notch!

Eaj7Ba2bk0VDtLR0mPjjDQ.text: They have SOUR BEER!!! First time here and we loved it. We had the crab dip and as appetizer and  Beef Brisket Banh Mi but substituted for a regular burger bun and it was delicious! The fries were fresh and the dipping sauces were awesome. Our server was attentive and super nice. We will definitely become regulars here!

LyW2S4KJ8pi0G300xrJY5w.text: Love this place, craft beer and bar food with great staff. Only wish it was closer to home!

_ghfIu-tI9oAgMBg5CBXpw.text: What a cool place! Just moved to the area and went here when I had family in town.  What a fun little spot for snacks and great beer and wine.  I love that there's a little gem like this in the neighborhood.   Everyone should give it a shot.

T45jLw6uFYsyPrnXqT3RkQ.text: Came tonight for my second time in less than a week. The food is ridiculous. I want to try everything. First time in I had the loco moco fries, those were amazing. The gravy had such had flavor to it that I had to force myself to stop eating it. Tonight's meal was no different. I had the pork belly banh mi and it was the best banh mi I've ever had! The drink selection is good too. I had a craft cocktail each time I've been in and also tried the grapefruit sour they have, so far nothing has been a disappointment. I like the small bar feel and the staff was very delightful. They have been very attentive and friendly both times I've been in. I'm looking forward to going back soon and trying the fried deviled eggs!

r-W5gLBoNb_HG30uR7cwkQ.text: This place has the worst service I've ever experienced. My boyfriend and I walked in and there were no employees anywhere. There were some people seated at the bar with food and drinks already, but no bartender, host, or waiter in sight. We stood around for a few minutes wondering if it was self seating or not. We wanted to sit at the booths but there was a large partition and we didn't want to be overlooked so we decided to sit at the bar, seeing as how there were no waiters to be found. Through the small window in the door we could see "employees" in the back walking around. It appeared that one was either eating or drinking something in the back. 5 minutes pass by.... what seemed like 10 minutes passed by until someone finally walked out. At this point we were about to walk out. No apology. He tended to the customers that were already there first. Finally he came over and handed us menus. He clearly had no service industry experience. We basically had to flag him down to order drinks and food. It took about 5 minutes in between each order because he kept walking away and talking to other people and wouldn't check in on us. We basically had to interrupt him to order things. And when we did he just gave us a blank look and said OK or YEAH. We ordered the loco moco poutine with has option of spam or hamburger and he didn't even bother to ask which we wanted. We had to tell him to make sure he knew. We had to order our Bahn mi through the other bar tender, who was a smidge more personable. Our food came and it smelled and looked amazing. But once we took a bite of the poutine... it wasn't very good. Gravy was too thick and bland. The Bahn mi sandwich was decent. The pork belly was cooked well but all I tasted was raw jalapeno. We finished our drinks and No one asked if we wanted a refill. We asked for the check and waited forever because the guy was talking to other patrons. We had to ask again because we thought he forgot. Then I think he realized we were upset and then started being friendly. A little too late. He made small talk about my tattoo and informed me that he was a tattoo artist. Not sure why is was working the bar. Overall... this wouldn't such a bad place if the service was even decent but the customer service is non existent and the bar was dirty, it had a bunch of dried beer on it and had not been wiped. Not sure if I came on an off day or what, but I really don't understand how it has such  good reviews.

HeQL8QGpS3UqO5-i_QvbzA.text: My boyfriend and I love craft beer and were so excited to try this new place with such a focus on bringing in the best beers from the surrounding areas. We went last night for the first time and the selection didn't disappoint. Normally we like 1-3 beers on the menu, but Craft Kitchen had at least 10 that we loved. The servers were so knowledgeable and friendly, they brought us over samples of beers they thought we'd like without us even requesting to try them. I also loved the asian fusion in the menu and that their support of the local community is reflected in both the food (using Great Buns bread) and beer menu. We will definitely be back!

N622RZ6d4rlenQt9mD6kLA.text: Wanted something different and my lady found this new little gem. The Chef helped opened Momofuku and you can definitely see that on the menu. A lot of Asian inspired dishes with a few new Americana options , like the pretzels and beer cheese with sea salt. Only been opened a couple weeks. I liked it and we will definitely be coming back.

Vey1QR6xs87UlMEKpKXI6Q.text: Bartender was talking and walking around looking bored but we still had to flag him down every time we needed something. Didn't check on us once.  If he was busy I would have understood. Really small bar for 2 bartenders to run and still give shitty service. Only reason I gave 2 stars was because the USB shirt guy was awesome and came out at the end and actually provided customer service. Thanks USB shirt guy!

5hyHVylwtCByCYE2DjSQig.text: Vacation with friends & family. New, bright staff, relaxed vibe.  Beer list is extensive, food was delish. We'll be back in October... so many choices... so many beers

CV7N2xjO3hU2fR8rbzOzOA.text: Amazing decor. Great cocktails and amazing rotating craft beer selection. The Omnipollo IPA is to die for. Crab dynamite was legit and the banh mi's were fantastic. Charles our server and bartender was awesome. Good ish on you my dude!

3_s0aPS0QYg0OITmWmBA1w.text: Great beers and food.  Try the deep fried deviled eggs.  Everyone at our table raved about the food and beer.  Will go back again.

g561JO22THi3o2QiofdTJA.text: The service is good, but I did not enjoy my food: bahnmi with pork.   The pork was very chewy.   Hummus was very good.  Chicken wing was so so

S8VmnZfXVz8bufZlQAuwFQ.text: Went there 3 times. First time the service was great. Bartender was very helpful in suggesting some different craft beers. Food was really good also. The second and third time the service was terrible. Different bartenders both times. I was going to eat but after my first beer was done they never came over to see if I wanted another or if I wanted to order food. Won't be returning

blQyKUge7wSYyrejhoKbvw.text: Amazing. Don't drive by - stop in.  We almost did and it would have been a major oversight.  The cook is not a chef - more like an artist and the Pork Belly Banh Mi is his masterpiece. The Ice Box Buttermilk Cheesecake is not only fantastic it is served like no other cheesecake I've seen. I have traveled the country on business and have had the fortune to eat at some very good restaurants, on top of that Las Vegas is blessed with some extremely good locally owned ones - 595 Craft & Kitchen ranks as one of the best and has made my Vegas must do list. Some restaurants in Vegas I go back and order my favorite. This place is so good I intend to try something different on the menu each visit.

al30qkrsYvv0ifQ-H5rQPg.text: Went in here after it opened and was excited for a new bar in the area. We had frequent d meraki grill next door and was long anticipating its opening. We went in around 1130 on a Saturday and sat at the bar. The bartender was very friendly and offered great service. We enjoyed their beer selection and immediately ordered one for the lady and I.  We ordered the brisket banh mi and a burger for the lady with fries. The brisket was $11 with an extra $3 for a side salad. The burger was around the same. The burger came out and was good but small and overpowered by the lettuce on top. The brisket sandwich lacked any brisket. A $11 brisket sandwich should have more than one layer of brisket. It also didn't complement the bread (which was good). The bread was large and at least three times the height of the brisket which further made the lack of brisket even more significant. The sandwich had good flavors but ultimately would have been happier eating at subway.  Hopefully they're able to add some more meat to that sad sad brisket sandwich.  Tldr: beers great food lacks value.

8lTKlvFuAvOim1cs9TpKPQ.text: Awesome food, cocktails and beer selection. Owners, bartenders and mangers are amazing. This place makes me feel right at home...except the food, drinks and beer are better. Finally found a place on my side of town that I absolutely love!

cBSzLaqeSAqDPRvqlels2Q.text: Loved this place!  The Thai cashew hummus was out of this world!  Delicious!! Crispy chicken skin was tasty too.  Nice beer selection. Service was great. Friendly staff. We will definitely come back to try some of the other choices on the menu.  Laid back atmosphere.

Az-me0ivJ66uuc-rngc8Dg.text: Hubby and I ate here tonight and loved it. Chelsea and Mark were our servers and recommended delish food and cocktails. Fried  deviled eggs, crab dip, hamburger, pork belly bahn mi were all exceptional! Craft beer (local and from Cali) and craft cocktails. Who can beat that? Chelsea and Mark were fab: sweet, friendly, and attentive. Awesome music and a vibe that reminds us so much for cool joints in Sonoma/Napa/Bay Area/So Cal.b

DL9xQxJtJzz22ca_RmwE2A.text: small place, fast service and amazing food

InWEQfeq2ysp4j4Vh-Hwsw.text: This bar is small, but has a good ambiance. They have plenty of choices for beers and offer a few signature cocktails. My friend and I sat at the bar and all the bartenders that helped us were friendly. They also let me try a couple of their beers before I decided. It took a while for us to get our bill though and we had to ask twice. Their food is quite average. Portions are generous, but flavors are not all there. We shared the furikake tuna burger, the crispy chicken skins, and the traditional poutine. We like the crispy chicken skins the most (the one at carson kitchen is way better though). Tuna burger was edible, but nothing special. I say skip the poutine. The fries was soggy and flavorless and the gravy was tasteless. I'd go back for their beers, but not for their food.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken skins

ABZxJ3CWJ0GAq54_nctw2Q.text: Summary: Good service, dark industrial pub interior/atmosphere, good/great food depending on what you get.  Service was very friendly and attentive. I appreciated the advice on the poutines! While we ordered the bad ass chili poutine, we ended up with the beer cheese poutine. It wasn't the end of the world, since the beer cheese poutine was pretty good anyway.  I liked the industrial overhaul from what the Elements restaurant was, but I'm not a fan of the not well lit interior. I like to see my food, and my company, and it makes taking food pictures a lot more challenging (I realize that's a dumb reason :) ).  We ended up with beer cheese poutine, pork belly burger, and crispy chicken skins. Beer cheese poutine was tasty, even though it wasn't what we ordered, but it wasn't really a poutine, more like fries with cheese sauce. The crispy chicken skins were good, it wasn't greasy, but the sweet chili sauce it came with was a let down. The pork belly burger was the highlight of the meal. So. Delicious. Nothing needed to change about it.  Overall I would be back again since it's close to home and has some truly delicious options.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top left: pork belly burger Too right: crispy chicken skins Bottoms: beer cheese poutine

f_s__-YdR3Lh_fhXu0AWGw.text: This place has good and tasty food!  This is a gastropub atmosphere and so it is loud inside. They do need a larger beer selection though.  Every dish we tried was very flavorful and I did not have any complaints about the food. It was weird that we didn't have any plates to use and all had to eat out of the trays that the food was served on. The food here is meant to share I would recommend it as well so you can try all the different dishes.  The service on the other hand needs improvements it as always hard to get the waitresses.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings!
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KkO5oruF8CX2EtYQrJf-_Q.text: I'm not a big atmosphere place but..... But.....  I really like it here.    I feel like I'm in my living room having a beer with friends and the culinary dudes/dudettes are getting tipsy in the kitchen sending out their favorite comfort food to the lazy ones of us that just want to chill on the sofa.   Nice chill beat coming from the speakers.  Quiet tv's with sports  Nothing but craft beers on tap.   Server : Tristian  Exceedingly warm and friendly.  She's like the only chick you've ever dated that your friends will let you invite on camping trips.   Chill, cool, warm, friendly , funny..,, she carried a perpetual infectious smile.   I felt welcome here.   And the food was fantastic.   --  I've now been here 3 more times.  Food and service continue to be fantastic.  Great salads.  Best double fried fries ever.   Server Casey. Incredibly warm and friendly.   Thanks 595   --------------- Again and again and again.  I think my naive and I who live in Alaska patronize 595 as much as a local.   Can't stop coming here.  Stopped by yet again.  I thought I'd be good with a song order.  Nope! I had to order a second serving.  So juicy , flavorful, easy to bite a chunk of chicken protein off a bone.   Between the gourmet fries The artistic salads , and the beer.  I wish I lived next door.  Well..... then I'd be drunk and stuffed all the time!  Hmmmm Not a bad idea.   Wanna get stuffed and buzzed.   Come in! ------  Next day 4-12-18  Stopped by AGAIN! The VERY NEXT DAY!?  I must like this place!!! --------------  4-16/18.  AGAIN!!! Damn the fries here are fantastic.  I've tried to make my own at home. Water soaking  Double frying, getting the best counter top Grier I can get...( no such thing)  595 soaks their potatoes for thee hours in cold water to draw the starches out, then fries them.  Then...... Fries then a second time.  Makes me want to spend 400$ on my own 220v fryer to use next to my outdoor grill.....  hmmmm maybe not.   It's a lot easier to get served these delicacies at 595 and get s beer to boot. ( faster too)  The wings are so juicy.  I'm afraid to try to poutine, it's also made from scratch.  My bellies big enough.  I have enough addictions.   The fries are one of them.   Servers and ambiance are so warm.  Thanks 595! -----------/ AGAIN. 4th visit this week ! God the fries are orgasmic.  Casey. Our favorite server.  Smiley,warm,conversational when time allows.  What a gem.

TK8qY1i75l4T--HJP179Nw.text: The rise of gastropubs have reached an apex in the valley; many of which offer a wide variety of beers to tickle ones curiousity. 595 is no exception. A solid combination of stouts, ales and sours can fill up your beeradvocate card quickly. I came for the Belching Beaver Mexican Peanut Butter Stout and the Cherry Sour. The one impressive and ever changing trait is the menu. Yes, they do have the typical bar favorites as the hamburger and fries, but they include banh mis, poutine, and other savory dishes that beats the usual "x food pairs with y beer" archtype. The crispy chicken skins are so devishly delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-psDKOijW3VK8xL95mK_LQ.text: I was visiting from San Diego and a friend suggested that I try this place out. Boy was she right! The food was delicious, the beer was exceptionally cold, and the customer service was great. I ordered the Pork Belly Banh Mi, which was sexy AF. Just the right amount of spice, sweet, and savory. The fries were fresh as hell and complimented the sando perfectly. Damn good beer as well. The owners really know their sh*t. If you want to get away from the hustle & bustle of the strip and have a good beer & burger, I definitely recommend stop by and becoming a regular here. Prices are pretty decent considering the selection of brews on tap and the quality of food.  Best part for me was the cold strip!!! Never have I ever seen such a thing; keep your drinks cold on the bar. DOPE AS HELL!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork Belly Banh Mi

Bh9YVWUZtAT7yYNfG1WHhQ.text: We love this neighborhood bar/restaurant. Great friendly service, great craft brews on tap, consistent food, and fun atmosphere. They show all Vegas Knights games and their happy hour menu has great options and prices. I highly recommend 595 Craft Kitchen and will continue to visit as often as I can.

WnXR3e4peKZdMF3HTSs2gg.text: This is becoming me and my boyfriend's go-to bar. Super chill vibes with a pretty good beer selection. Nice selection of rotating drafts, including local beers. TVs everywhere, of course, with a clear view in every seat.  The food is not amazing, but I really enjoy the Asian/Vietnamese fusion. I tried their Furikake Tuna Burger, Craft Burger (added bacon and egg), and Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich. The tuna burger was just okay, but I really liked the Craft Burger. During happy hour, I like getting the Bahn Mi slider and my boyfriend LOVES the Chicken Skins, which I personally don't like, as it basically tastes like all fried breading and barely any actual chicken skin.   On nice days out, they slide the windows up so you can feel some breeze, adding some more *chill* to the bar. They also have wifi, games (like Cards Against Humanity, Cranium playing cards), and coloring books!

ZKye6WB0Q6VUUO0uHositQ.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  I really liked 595.  I didn't expect to be blown away but the bahn mi I had was the largest version I've ever had and tasty to boot.  I added an egg and the soggyness created a perfect addition.  The beer menu is quite good with a bunch of unknown San Diego breweries on draft.  They let you sample which I always enjoy, though no flights were offered.  The entrees ranged from $9-13 and the beers were around $6-7.  Plenty of TVs and high tops make it a great spot to watch some sports if in the area.  The food is very unique with a Vietnamese entree feel, but also specializing in poutine and fries.  Overall I really enjoyed 595 and recommend it as a new beer locale in the city.

NdV72ZCX6zbrU4a-1hRixQ.text: Came here on a Wednesday night and it was packed. Got the mule, deviled eggs and the hummus. The hummus wasn't all that great but the drinks and eggs were pretty good. My biggest issue was the slow service. There were only two people working and the place was full so trying to get someone to take our order or bring out food or drinks took a while.

I told The owner  Van this and he said that was his goal . We tried a few different beers from the wide array of what looks like a ever changing draft beer list .   The service was good and attentive .   The food was above average bar  foodie fare. We got the crispy chicken skins , the fried deviled eggs And the pretzel with beer cheese . All we're very good and would reorder .   The ambience is part dive and part gastropub .   Overall a great bar pub and one that we will be returning to.

IBIggT2W5RLqJuEfHyq-Ag.text: First time customer and I would have to say that I was not disappointed at all. I was glad that we found this on yelp! It is a cute little place on rainbow and you can choose to sit either at the bar or in their little dining room area. I would say that their food ranges from regular bar foods to Asian fusion. And they have a good variety of beers on tap, kombucha, wines, and even nitro cold brew coffees.   I had the cocktail called the Mezcal Cup and it was very light and refreshing with the mint and cucumber. Something I would definitely order every time especially around the summer time.   The traditional poutine was really great. The gravy wasn't too bland or too heavy and with their perfectly crispy fries and fried egg on top made it heavenly.   So I love banh mi's and theirs just hits the spot. I had the pork belly and the pork was marinated very well and it was a good slice of meat that wasn't too fatty which is what I was worried about. It had a jalapeno aioli as well as pickled vegetables like a traditional one would.   I would really want to go again to try more of the sides and other banh mi's

i8G5iwcxfMH8R5XiPW5fUA.text: Great chill spot for happy hour and bar food. It's got a fun Asian twist on the menu. It's very casual and laid back. I wish I could have enjoyed my food more.  Stopped in for dinner, we were seated right away. We ordered the Thai cashew hummus which was amazing. It comes with grilled pita and crispy wonton chips. And topped with a little bit of pickled veggies. That was my favorite item. I decided to go with the broccolini banh mi as my entree. The waitress did warn me it was spicy. I wanted to like but the sauce was overpowering the entire sandwich and it wasn't a good sauce. So that was disappointing. But the BF got their garbage fries: brisket, pork belly, chicken, mozzarella cheddar, guacamole, pico de Gallo and cilantro lime crema. That dish we both enjoyed. The flavors were great, like carne asada fries on crack. Fries were crispy and not soggy.   Overall good experience here, really enjoyed the vibe. Good service too. Hoping to come back to try another dish when we are in town again.

LsvAeGZVPCDL0Hxeln8x3A.text: Family in town, wanting to try this place for a while, today was the day! Getting there about 630pm after work, missing happy hour. Husband got here first to arrange for seats while I picked up the family. Good thing he was there, very busy and we needed a big table! There are about five high tables, high bar seating around back wall and a bank of tables with half bench seats. The bar has plenty of seats.   Ordered a Odell's pale ale on tap, nice and cold. For apps we tried the Fried Deviled Eggs Togarashi + Scallion + Gochujang Aioli. Pretty good, the fried shell crunchy while egg remains moist.  We also got the Garbage Nachos Brisket + Pork Belly + Chicken House Cheese Blend + Pico de Gallo + Guacamole + Cilantro Lime Crema. Really good, fresh not too spicy.   For the main event, I chose the Signature Banh Mi Honey Soy Glazed BBQ Pork + Cucumber + Pickled Veggies + Cilantro + Jalapeno + Mayo + Maggi. It was on a great baguette, fresh, both crunchy and soft. I loved the fresh cilantro and the thinly slice jalapeno. Meat tender and tasty.   Three of the family tried the Pork Belly Burger* Cabbage Slaw + Gochujang Aioli + Fried Shallots, it was bit spicy for some. But I thought the spice just right.   And someone tried the Beer Brined Chicken Wings Buffalo, Gochujang Honey Fish Sauce or Hoisin Sambal + Buttermilk Dressing + Celery Sticks. She thought them to be too spicy, I didn't try them but my husband agreed about too hot, but he's not much of a heat guy!  Overall, impressed with the freshness, the spice and the combinations, loved it and would go again. Wait staff quick and attentive, friendly and helpful with selections.

V5L5Lsgw-GqoYlcgkazOLA.text: Amazing selection of draft beer. Food was also amazing that I had to order seconds to take home for later lol. Matt the craft bartender was really knowledgable on his craft beers and was a great person to talk to. Would go visit again when I'm around the area

qOMWmyGjeiwlaCXhSya-DA.text: This is a truly sad story. Whoever's vision it was to create this concept spent a ton of time, imagination and money to put this restaurant together. They did a fantastic job, 5.5 on the restaurant scale. But, if you are someone like me, who doesn't necessarily understand craft beer, you are going to need a bartender that is patient and understands people's beer taste to get them what they like. And, as a bartender that wants to work at a craft beer bar, you should want to get the customer the perfect beer because they will take your recommendation on anything moving forward. Gain the trust, get the money =) What happened at my experience is that I arrived on a Sunday afternoon, there were two tables sat in the dining room, and two people sitting at the bar. The bartender asked me what I would like to drink and like any human being, when there's a million choices, it will take a second. I told the bartender what I usually drink, she poured me two small samples and I didn't like either. She looked super frustrated so I asked the gentleman to the left of me what type of beer he was drinking. He said some sort of IPA. I said, "fine, I will have one of what he is having." The beer was definitely not the type of beer I would ever drink again but I didn't want to deal with the bartender's attitude to find the perfect match for my palette. To the investors, owners, or whoever, you did so much work to put this restaurant together and it is sad that someone who gets paid minimum wage and has no stake in the game and most likely doesn't care, can ruin your vision and the guest experience to the point where I am writing a novel to tell you something is definitely broken at your bar. Best of luck, your menu is fantastic =)

TPGnb-8uEDNjYcw6I7Ghuw.text: The beer selection is really good and the staff there can help you pick out something that suits your tastes. 595 isn't very large, but it can accommodate a group or two. There are also board games available to you to pass the time.  We had the deviled eggs, which were good, but I think my family and I are more prone to the traditional recipe. We also ordered the garbage nachos and the hangover fries. Hands down the fries were the most popular at our table. The nachos are really good, but that fry sauce and pickled chilis made the fries that much better. They both come out on a platter and could easily feed 3 people each, unless you're super hungry, Either way, the portions are decent. We didn't have any room for the bread pudding and was told this particular batch wasn't always going to be available, so I hope it'll be around when I return.  I would definitely recommend 595 Craft and Kitchen.

xaVeikkwEXMXQkM0xfGV2A.text: Ive always told my girl about this place. We love to go for food and drinks. I was excited to eat, my first question (as far as liquor) was do you have Hennessy? He said yes. We ordered our food and waited. Then he comes and we order drinks. HE DENIES MY GIRLFRIEND A DRINK "because SHE SLURRED "  earlier. It was so crazy I thought it was a joke. So we just walked out. HIS NANE WAS ERIC. ASIAN WEIRDO. Honestly she's just mad now. But we just walked out after ordering because that was crazy. I won't keep my girl out if she's at the point if slurring, so for him do say that was upsetting. She was upset so she said let's go so we left. Point is Asian dude night shift Tuesday 11:30pm aug 20th HORRIBLE BARTENDER! HORRIBLE SERVER! I really wanted her to try the food.

KZ5nJxDj2jx7QXN19dDZ4Q.text: May I suggest the Pork Belly Banh Mi for your pleasure?  Seriously - I have not had anything at 595 that I did not enjoy.   From the loco moco poutine to the bread pudding of the day; you are sure to be pleased with all the offerings at 595. On my most recent visit - we ordered pulled pork belly tacos (it was the daily special), a pork belly banh mi and s'mores bread pudding.   The pork belly tacos were delicious - cooked to a juicy and tender perfection. The tortillas were just a tad too "crisp" for my liking and I do wish there was a little less guac and a little more salsa - however, it was still great and I would definitely have them again. The pork belly banh mi is still my favorite offering at 595. It's so good, ya'll! Amazingly seasoned pork belly accompanied by cucumber, pickled veggies, cilantro and an amazing jalapeno mayo...I promise it will not disappoint. I wish I had a photo to share but I was way too busy stuffing my face. The bread pudding changes frequently. The s'mores bread pudding was so good! Previously, we had a peanut butter cup bread pudding. Also delicious, but slightly too sweet for my taste.  Overall, always a great experience here. It does get a little crowded during major sports games - other than that, all tables are fair game. Stop in soon!

7luXpd2srUC-pwzYLiK_CA.text: I really like this place from the music setting to the decor , really nice patio seating area.Overall has a really good ambiance. The food was amazing' $11 for that lunch special. Whew definitely will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. craft burger and fries.

9eIskx1XS1mFHmxzH-FwqA.text: I might've been a little hard-pressed to give more than 4 stars if I'd visited here only for food, but now that I'm also a fan of craft beer, this is one of my new favorite spots.  595 Craft and Kitchen is a gastropub in an area of town which isn't as well-known for that sort of thing. As I suggested above, the highlight is their craft beer selection, which is comprised of 24 rotating draft beers from local and remote breweries, more so the latter. That's great for someone like me who wants to have new tastes, and so are the $5-7 prices for most of the taps (with a few understandably pricier choices).  I won't spend (relatively) too much time on describing the beers themselves, but considering my enjoyment of each of my choices, it's a feather in 595's cap that they've procured such a selection.  I started with some beers priced awesomely for happy hour ($1 off non-local beers, from Mon-Fri 3-6pm and midnight-close), namely Mikkeller (San Diego)'s Big Hazy NE TIPA ($4 for about 10-12 oz) and the Mother Earth / Melvin collaboration Four Seasons, Spring 2018 edition (also $4 for about 10-12 oz). The Big Hazy was delicious and somewhat reminiscent of the trendy hazy IPA style, while the Four Seasons stayed more toward traditional yet fruit-tinged IPA territory.  Next, I ventured into the specials of this particular day, the $4.20 beers. I got the New Belgium Hemperor HPA first, and I'm glad to have had such a unique experience. It smells exactly like the smoke produced by one method of usage of a particular recreational/medicinal drug which has been legalized in certain states, including Nevada. The burps also have that scent. Then I went for the Lagunitas Waldos' Special Ale, which is inspired by the group credited with creating the term 420, but certainly doesn't have as much of that "dank" quality. However, I still enjoyed the rich, relatively "sweet" flavor and would gladly order it again.  Food-wise, I mostly stuck to the aforementioned happy hour deals. They'll be more than enough to satisfy my palate next time I come here, although I wouldn't mind branching out.  The banh mi slider ($3) was surprisingly True to what you might expect if you miniaturized a grilled pork Vietnamese sandwich, including all the veggies, a small baguette, a hit of something spicy, and even mayonnaise. I won't make any claims due to my inebriated status, but I would order that again.  The fries ($3) were a gigantic portion of somewhat thickly cut potatoes, and I liked them despite most pieces ending up relatively soft. They came with one helping of ketchup and two helpings of something that's like a fry/special/secret sauce, but slightly different - a higher amount of horseradish, perhaps? I enjoyed them from start to end of meal, hot to cold (room temp).  The chicken wings ($5) came out with a less-than-ideal sauce, after the bartender defaulted to buffalo style without asking me for my choice, but I still enjoyed them. Five moist pieces arrived with a mild version of buffalo sauce, proper seasoning, and a moist if not juicy interior. The ranch and celery were therefore not strictly necessary, but they were fun. These aren't battered, but you'll be able to find enough carbs elsewhere I'm sure.  I was also able to try the special of the day in the food realm, namely 2 tacos for $4.20. They were pork belly "chicharron" tacos, and both came out with properly cooked(!) tortillas, which sometimes is a challenge for restaurants for some reason. The belly was rich in flavor and had crunchy bits, and the guacamole added enough creaminess to make it not so boring. Hopefully they'll consider making this a more permanent menu item.  Atmosphere was great, although I should disclaim that having the proper amount of beer makes every place pretty tolerable. It was on the louder side, but not so much that you couldn't hold a conversation. Service was pretty solid aside from denying me the chance to try some of the fancier chicken wing sauces (but I've decided to try those in the future already, so I'm not too bummed).  I will definitely return to 595 Craft and Kitchen, especially for weekday happy hour. This is the best and most affordable combination of craft beer and great food in town so far, and although it's somewhat far from Henderson, I've been known to drive to Rainbow Blvd on a weekly basis in the past.

gcmTz7KoQpeXbg2_3k5B3w.text: This place has plenty of choices when it comes to beers. Additionally, they are definitely helpful when helping you choose a beer. My wife chose an IPA and she hates the hoppy beers. It was an awesome choice too.   The food is typical bar fare, cranked up to eleven. I had the pork belly banh mi and I thought it tasted delicious. The beer cheese was meh, but its hard to make that amazing in my opinion. Coming back if I am in the neighborhood.

kT6cn3QDMJk7t6jDTc8W0g.text: Best craft beer selection in town from pales, IPAs, ciders and sours. The beer list is constantly changing from top local beer selections to well established breweries like Able Baker, Belching Beaver, Dogfish, PizzaPort, ImBib, Modern Times, and so much more. Service is on point. Highly recommend their craft burger and don't forget to add bacon...it's worth it. Or order a house salad with pork belly to save room for more beer. And if you are on a budget they always have 2 for $5 pulled pork tacos available.

7Mx-0cQGYmvAYdIxrpMNcA.text: Do you like beer ? Do you like craft beer? Do you like it ice cold? Well 595 has all three with out a doubt. 24 taps of Stouts, ales, IPA's, Sours, constantly changing line up of kegs so always something new to sink your taste buds into. Now for the really "cool" part. The bar counter top has an ice cold steel rail built into it that you set your beer glass on top of to keep you drink ice cold.(I've included pictures) I've only seen this at one other bar before (in Salt Lake City) I can't believe more places haven't incorporated this awesome experience enhancing addition.   The bar and table area is not too big so it can fill up fast. We were in on a Saturday evening and it started out real quiet but a few hours in and the place was bustling. People laughing, drinking, eating and having a good time. The decor is pub style, clean and comfortable. Two unisex bathrooms that are well kept also.    The food menu is just the right size and will satisfy the hardiest of beer munchies. Items range from finger foods, salads, Springs rolls, nachos to unique sandwich and burger choices. Tonight we snacked on the Thai hummus appetizer (flavor explosion )while sipping on bar tender recommended IPA's.   The whole staff seemed to take on any duty necessary to keep everyone eating, drinking and having a good time. I especially enjoy that there is no video poker and that they're not just another run of the mill, cookie cutter, average, smoke filled Vegas strip mall bar.   Unique, fun and satisfying. Get down and get join the party for yourself. What are you waiting for!!!?????

wu4Guh1DoJwK76mYZmnshA.text: Great setting, casual and comfortable space, hidden in a small strip-mall.  Smaller on the inside than it looks from the outside, definitely a good place to go with a group of friends.  We ordered the wings. Those are a must! I almost never clean to the bones... these were good enough to. Crispy wings, moist meat, incredible sauce.  We also both ordered pub burgers, cooked medium. I added a farm fresh egg - they broke the egg, probably while building, bummer. He got his with bacon. This made them $15 burgers. Were they? Not really. Probably would've paid $12 total. They were cooked great, good size; a little fatty. Probably a 70/30 ground beef.  Last note: they have games there including cards against humanity, in case you don't want to watch sports on one of their three screens.

Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings. Served with pickled carrots and jicama - think kim-chee flavors.

rIS3B-dWGu5SlqqYdtNVDA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the area!! The food is delicious and so unique. All the dishes are a fusion of different cultures and I love it. They have an amazing bar area and a bunch of board games to play with friends. The atmosphere of the restaurant is refreshing and I'm so glad I found it on my way home. I definitely recommend you try it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

8UYYD2otsDkC3Mgi9-Rxsg.text: Being from Vegas this place is so cool to me. First of all it closes at 2am. I know, typically, people hate this but I'm born and raised in Vegas and any place that doesn't let me stay there all night is a win in my book! That means that I know for certain my boyfriend can't convince me to stay out longer than 2, and we get to say we closed the bar down ! Second of all, there's no gaming and you can't smoke inside. Yes and yes ! I won't lose extra money feeding the game machine after I've had too much to drink! I also won't come home smelling like an ashtray.   We came on a Friday night and it wasn't packed but they were busy enough. It took awhile for anybody to come around and take our order which is where the one star drops off. Whenever they did come around (which wasn't often) they were really nice though. In the corner they have a ton of games you can choose from to play with your friends. Our group chose exploding kittens! We had a really great time :).  Also we all ordered different things and every one of us was pleased with our selections. The deviled eggs, hummus, spring rolls, and pork bun were all a hit at our table ! Will definitely be back to try out more craft beers, more of their food menu, and to play some games while doing so.  Good hangout spot !

EW42UzG2wlQXZjeDglTTag.text: There aren't enough eateries, let alone craft kitchens that serve food made in house, down to the sauces. They support local business and promote local brews, which makes this place a cornerstone for good eats. The ambiance is fantastic, with tables that have that butcher block nouveau feel. It's comfortable and the service is fantastic. What's even better is the food.  The menu has an amazing variety of Asian and American fare, from their in-hoise cured pork belly to the Butcher Block (the Vegas meat vendor, yes) burger, and their varieties of poutine. We have the chicken wings, Asian style, and their made from scratch burrata with ginger apricot chutney a try for starters. The wings hit hard with great soy and gochuchang flavor, crispy on the first bite, and finger licking good--literally.  The burrata is a gentle cloud of cheese goodness that is enhanced by the chutney.   The butcher block burger is so well seasoned and cooked to perfection that squeezing down with my fingers against the bun bring out a lot of juice. The toppings don't overpower the great flavor of the burger itself, but compliment it with every bite. On top do the beautiful bun, it's a perfect meal with or without fries. However, the fries here are made with love, so I strongly suggest ordering a side with aioli. The hot Fried chicken is spicy, crunchy goodness topped with cool lettuce and pickles. It's just a great chicken sandwich that satisfies any southern chicken cravings. I highly recommend the poutine made with gravy made in house and some cheese curds and a fried egg. Lovely, crispy fries that don't get soggy even with gravy, it was creamy, perfectly flavored goodness. I wanted to lick the paper! I know now that every visit here will include poutine no matter what.  Dessert was amazing, served in the cutest jars and with crumbles that felt like my childhood cookie dreams on a plate. The dark chocolate dessert topped with sea salt and crumble, olive oil drizzle and roasted hazelnuts was crunchy, chocolate goodness. Almost close to a ganache but still at a mousse consistency, I enjoyed every chocolatey, nutty bite. Their cheesecake topped with yuzu and served with strawberries and a shortbread crumble with olive oil drizzle made my night! Light, citrus tones and sweet cookie crumble made this dessert a must for those wanting a sweet but light finish.  Paired with local beers, each part of the experience was fun and a True experience. I love the fact that the owner and chef work hard to make everything from scratch, because it shows with every bite. I appreciate the care and love in the food, and look forward to our trip through the menu soon.   Followers, you know how my five stars don't come easy. Trust me when I say this place deserves five full stars. You won't regret eating here, ever.

Myj1QLjzr4eQKuOAEdXKQg.text: Great service. Beer on point and what grear foot. Will be back for more. The bar tender was super nice.

UgktrrZT72ufJz7d5wzuyw.text: Tristian our server was a delight!! She was fun and energetic. The Garbage Nachos were very good. The sambal chicken wings were hot and spicey. We'll be back.

9L_hsO3kl8-iOcRM1_DhMQ.text: I see that 595 Craft and Kitchen has a lot of potential! They have a great selection of beer, and drinks. Our bartender took the time to ask us what kind of drinks we liked, to better compliment our tastes. Incredibly friendly and easy to talk to. When you walk in, its open seating. You'll find that the atmosphere is friendly and cozy. Perfect place to catch up with a friend or watch the game.  But what I came here for is the Vietnamese geared food, with a twist. Yes, they do have food such as fries and chicken. But what caught my attention was their Beef Brisket Banh Minh Sandwich and Pork Belly Burger. Both of which were delicious! Both dished we ordered were a blend of tender meat, cooked to perfection, fresh and crisp radish and carrots. I will say that their meat does lean on the salty side. These are great when paired with their fries.  But if a burger or sandwich isn't what your craving, fear not! You have the option to opt for a salad or taste something light from their appetizers. Or, if you feel like having sweets they do have something to help you satisfy that as well. They have bread pudding, cheesecake, and chocolate budino(kind of like a cake/pudding hybrid)!

geikjZppg7dRO2B8iEXeRQ.text: My boyfriend and I were craving burgers and beer. We were tired from work and definitely not in the mood to go out to the strip. I remember seeing a food instagrammer post about this place so I checked it out immediately! To be honest, we both were not expecting this place to be that good since I never kept up with those food bloggers. Plus, it is a beer pub.  HOWEVER, this place had so many craft beers to choose from. Our server let us try samples until we could decide what to order. We even told her that we are a blonde ale fan and she knew immediately what to reach out for (Super chill and sweet). Each server checked up on us on a timely manner and it wasn't difficult to reach out to them even if the table/bar area is a bit segregated.  Now with the food, the fried deviled eggs were amazing. The crispiness with the soft boiled eggs were an amazing combination. The gochujang aioli wasn't super spicy and overpowering either. The pork belly banhmi had a nice jalapeno kick to it and the craft burger was extremely juicy.   I would definitely come back again to try the other beers and menu items. The menu items definitely has a twist of American and Asian fusion, which I love!!

F35GowFQizvk86YsAWC0HQ.text: I was really excited to take my family from out of town here. I had been wanting to try this place for a while. I am sad to say I won't be returning.   Beer: the selection was awesome! The prices were really good for draft beers. This is the only part that deserves more than 2 stars.   Service: our waiter seemed seriously annoyed that he had to wait on us. Party of 6 that included 2 kids and 4 adults. If you can't act happy to serve people you need to be sent home.   Food: mediocre at best. We ordered a salad it was ok. 2 appetizers that came out with our meals. The kids food came out very last and it was the chili. The temperature of the chili was so hot we had to add several ice cubes to it. Not acceptable. We also ordered A bob mi sandwich that was tasteless.   They did have games for the family to play. That was a plus.

NfGY8QNPtXgmocxOldoPQg.text: Went for a quick happy hour and it was fast and delicious. Great beer selection and anyone who loves hummus HAS to try the cashew hummus it is by far some of the best hummus I've ever tasted!

KY8edD3trMZYwFLRNTreOA.text: We found 595 Craft and Kitchen while looking for some new exciting food and I am happy we came across it. The food here is made with many hours of work and lots of love. All that hard work and preparation shows in the layers of flavor the chef at 595 is able to produce. The combinations of flavors, service, and excellent craft beer pairings will keep me coming back for more.  In fact we came back the next day to get more great food and beers.   I got to try the Burrata with Ginger Apricot Chutney, Gochujang Honey Chicken Wings, Traditional Poutine, Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich, and the "Butcher Block" Craft Sandwich paired with a Mother Earth Big Mother Triple IPA. We came back the following day for the Craft Popcorn, Pork Belly Burger, and Banh Mi. The "Butcher Block" burger is named as such because the meat comes from the Butcher Block just down the street and the beautiful buns are locally sourced from Great Buns. The chicken  in the Hot Fried Chicken Sandwich stays crispy even with the hot sauce on it. That Pork Belly Burger had me wanting to order another one. I'm hooked on their Banh Mi and am excited to go back and try it with pork belly. All sauces are scratch made and flavorful. Needless to say that I think the food at 595 is amazing. I could write for days about it, but you should try it for yourself.

rF1_QW2h72pYVFCzzdQSTA.text: Walked in and right away noticed their rustic style and woodwork interior. I love stuff like this!!   Not just a pub but a Gastro pub! They focus on high- quality food then a regular pub. Very unique menu not often seen. I'm pretty sure there's no other pub in town like this. Right away I noticed crispy chicken skin on their menu. That was to die for. The skin was fried perfectly. It comes with a dipping sauce was so good!! I devoured that too!!   Now I'm a very picky eater when it comes to banh mi sandwiches. Meat needs to be tender and has to have lots of good flavors and bread needs to be perfect, not hard. I can't believe a place like this makes one of the best Banh mi sandwich!!   For those times you just feel like getting a drink and eating some really good food 595 craft and kitchen is the place! I will definitely be back to try their burgers and desserts.

_iPiJFDvDyJFcKbowAcuDg.text: Quickly becoming my favorite spot for grubs in Vegas. They're a new joint - and doing quite well so it seems.   Went in Wednesday night (the place is tucked away behind the rainbow Walgreens) - and was blown away. Cute place (tiny, but still seemingly ample seating), great decor, awesome vibe with the music - reminds me of a bar I would visit in beach town Charleston, SC.   Amazing service on Wednesday. Offered to sample many beers I wasn't familiar with. Ended up doing a beer/food pairing. Van, took great care of me and was very enthusiastic about my food selections. Always a good vibe when they get hyped about how you're eating the food.   Outstanding food. Seriously. Incredible. And very very fair priced. A side of out-of-this-world pork belly is very generous for $5. I went in alone, and crushed..  -an appetizer of the fried deviled eggs (being from the south - this was a foodgasm) // paired with blueberry wheat -Mixed greens salad with the garlic chicken and pork belly (omfg. Awesome. And they have chopsticks to enjoy the food slowly as intended) // paired with farmhouse ale -Nutella Dark Chocolate Almond Bread Pudding (I shared a photo with a friend.. this is a party in your mouth) // paired with cali' creamin.   The dessert was so damn good I almost ordered a second round. Except by this point I was stuffed.   SO I CAME BACK ON THURSDAY. I had to try the burgers. Had to. And god, am I glad I did. Also incredible. Perfect bun.   Only downside? Menu offered grilled or fried onions.. grilled onions gross me out so I asked for fried. They're still grilled.. bartender told me he meant to tell me that. Service tonight was okay, but not as mind blowing as Wednesday - they seemed preoccupied with personal convos. But no biggie. The food made up for it!! And the place is new, so turnover is bound to happen while ironing it out! Besides, once I got my bread pudding, all was forgotten.   Will definitely be back. And again soon.

My first time here I also ordered 4 different things off the menu and all of them were really good. Definitely a must try!

VL4jOaVft85eDaZj5ZChsg.text: I started getting into IPA's from my best friend because I wanted to venture away from the Blue Moon's. Been here twice and I really dig the chill atmosphere. The staff is pretty laid back. Very friendly and professional if you are not a beer savvy type of person like I am. The bartender was helpful and patient enough to have me try a bunch of IPA samples and find that one taste I'd like.   I already know I do not like the super hoppy taste. I wanted a fruit taste to help. I don't remember the name of the IPA I had at the time, but it was a great taste. Too bad they didn't carry it the second time. I do remember having an "Abomination IPA" recently and that was pretty good. To be honest, I'm amazed that I'm drinking these types of beers.   Anyway, aside from the amazing selection of craft beers. They have a surprising food menu that I typically don't see at a "bar/brewery." For example, they have friggin banh-mi sandwiches?! I didn't have to go to Chinatown or a Vietnamese restaurant for that. I ordered the shredded chicken banh-mi and it was soooo good. Also, the popular deviled eggs are worth it, the hangover fries (must), and the Craft Burger! (yess).   It will be my mission to try the rest of the menu as I'm sure it's all yummy. At least I can wash it down trying out new IPAs lol,

b7DPjGu-B82R34IyjuNE9g.text: Been craving a semi bougie gourmet burger so & I found this place on yelp! Tried the craft burger with an egg on it, pork belly burger and garbage nachos. Both burgers were super juicy, the egg's texture was silky with a runny yummy yolk, and the pork belly was braised & seasoned perfectly and soft as hell. The nachos were coo, no wow factor to me, the pieces of pork belly were a little dry but the dollop of guac on it was bomb. 5 stars cause the service was cherry, food came out in a timely manner, atmosphere and vibe were chill, nice and knowledgeable server & they have a lot of specials going on. If you check in you get a free beer, I forget what it was called but it was light and crisp! Also was told for any game that's playing, they hold happy hour the ENTIRE game! Def coming back for lunch, happy hour (they have two), or to watch a game!
