uB60uMaX79gU2vGPDM_mPw.text: WSOP Day 0x, 1x, 2x, 3x.  Yeah, between lunch specials, their 2nd anniversary celebration and just needing a beer kind of day, hit this up multiple times.  Solid craft beer pub with great pub grub minus the typical craft beer snobbery.  Food is where it's at.  This is beer food.  Flavors are bold and punchy.  Mate, you know how a pub works; order and share.  Fried deviled eggs (boiled, halved, coated in panko and togarashi and deep fried till golden brown then refilled with a gochujang aioli mixed back with its hard boiled yolk) makes for the perfect palate cleanser to nearly any hoppy offering.  Wings, not bad.  Well fried, well drained but excessively sauced.  The hoisin sambal, sweet chili and honey garlic BBQ tasty but strong begging for more light ales and lagers.  Pork belly bahn mi, very good.  Big slab of tender braised pork belly finished in a hoisin sambal glaze, this time taking advantage of the earthy, sweet, spicy stickiness to pair well with the jalapeno mayo and brightened by a handful of fresh cilantro and a tiny amount of pickled veg.   Beer food.  Better yet, the hot fried chicken sandwich.  Boneless, crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside thick chunk of chicken seasoned with fiery spices, deep fried, and splashed with hot sauce with a toasted brioche bun slathered with mayo simple lettuce and a slice of tomato.  Fiery kick and good eats!  Various poutines (traditional, hangover and stoner sampled), all A-OK.  This isn't Quebec so...  Very well chosen cross section of beer from all genres at all octane levels (light buzz to F you up).  US producers.  Good selection from local producers.  Changes regularly.  Good off Strip prices.  Daily HH.  15:00 - 18:00 M-F with reverse 23:00 - Close M-R.  See website for changing specials and details.  A bloody fine way to refuel and take the edge off before returning to the grind that is Vegas.

ZL5BNSYI5ctQe5-kESsWIQ.text: Craft beer, fresh food, plus no freezers!  This place is a hidden gem.. last night we had a party of four.  We ordered several beers a piece, sampled a few, and reordered a few. I like that the selections will rotate in and out.. so each time they should be a new experience!  The food and service was outstanding! We didn't wait on anything, all items came out hot, fresh and as ordered. Our waiter suggested a few things, and Oooomygawd they were delicious!  I'll be recommending this place to others, and come back myself again.. great job :-)

1SARXxb0LXapJkZyY4HKvA.text: Found this place by accident for lunch one day and I wasn't upset about it! First two pictures are of the Kurikake Tuna Burger with pickled shiitake, tomatoes, and a garlic aioli. This was one of their suggestions of the best things they served and I could see why. It was full of amazing flavor and texture. The side salad was great as well. The third and fourth pictures were the fried deviled eggs and they were off the chain! Don't get a chance to have fried deviled eggs very often, but these were the best ones I've ever had. Also came with the gochujang aioli that absolutely made it. The wait staff was super helpful and cool. This is a must try spot for sure!

le91BPo39MMnTjOfN2lLkA.text: Huge selection of beers. Food is decent and portions are generous. Nice local spot and a good place to bring your out of town visitors.  I got the spicy chicken sandwich. Flavor was great, decent amount of heat, but I asked for no pickles but it came with it anyway. Picked them off but still had some pickle juice on the sandwich which I'm really not a fan of. My friend got the seared ahi tuna burger, so juicy and cooked just right.   Went during a really slow hour, it was just me and my friend and another couple in the dining room, but it took a while to get our orders taken and then when it came time to pay the bill I couldn't find anyone. Had to wait at the bar about 5 minutes before someone asked how they could help so I could pay the bill. I understand that if a place is busy that waiting is to be expected. But there were literally only 2 tables occupied.

RLGnaJE4YOWMZhzrKAbFRw.text: I was like a kid in a candy store!  Selecting the next craft brew to enjoy was an adventure all it's own.  The unique offerings....especially IPA's.....was really special for a relatively small place with a neighborhood feel.   The Brouwerij West Picnic Lightning ($8), Revision Battle of the Lords ($6) and Bearded Iris Offbeat ($8) were right down my alley.  My friend went with a crazy Modern Times Nitro Stout ($6) and Belching Beaver Mosaic ($6) - and enjoyed them thoroughly.   We ordered the Thai Cashew Hummus ($9) and loved it - the Lavash cracker pairing was a very different dipping approach that we both enjoyed.   My buddy had his eye on the Hot Chicken Sandwich ($10) as it was called out in reviews and by our waiter as spicy.  He didn't leave any of it behind :)   I went with the Chicken Banh Mi ($9) and the toppings were really fresh - however I'd rather have less "bread" vs meat/toppings to enhance the flavor experience.  The fries on the side ($3) were awesome!  Service from Van Alan was spot on.  Love this place and can't wait to come back!

I ordered the pork belly burger and I remember it being greasy but not phenomenal or memorable.  I ordered the deviled eggs which were more like scotch eggs to me.  They were deep fried and bland... A little busy on a Friday where I think they should have at least two waitresses on staff being we waited a minute to order another round of cocktails and appetizers for a party of two. Great beer selections as well as having a full bar. Prices are decent just go during happy hour to get a better deal. They also have "check-in" perks so don't forget....

NA20UHhKSG6eno4HERrUnA.text: Great, affordable food accompanied by a decent selection of beers! I wish the music wasn't blaring death metal, but otherwise was fantastic. I would recommend the Vermicelli noodle salad.

Pu3-itUPDGU_G8qhRNLYeA.text: I read several reviews before coming here about how chill the environment is and how friendly the staff is, and honestly, I couldn't agree more! The menu was easy to understand and the bartender was very helpful in elaborating on the varied brews they served. Ended up ordering the Banh Mi with an egg on top and a nice brew! Absolutely loved the flavor profile and I can't wait to come back and try more items on the menu! Very tasty. Love it here, friendly staff and an easy going environment with great food and beer.

POf61CqYrepawnZmiOWkUw.text: A great selection of craft beers in Las Vegas.  Did some Yelp research and decided this was definitely a place I needed to try.  Bartenders and server was super friendly and helpful.  Lots of local brews and a few to the east that were more my taste.  They have a signature Banh Mi sandwich with pork but I opted for the Pork belly instead.  Man was it a treat.  Full of flavor and priced right.  Small place with about 10-12 bar seats and several tables and booths.  Kid friendly so that's a plus.  The only thing different is they do not do flights of beer.  I understand but it is always nice to sample a few than have 16oz of just 1.  Other than that this place is a great place to try some new beers and wonderful food.

O2imzDkiaH6EI_oT_kr34g.text: Been here a few dozen times and it's never been this bad...  The good ~ beer is fresh & food is on point, as usual.  The bad ~ with a FULL restaurant and bar top there was a single bartender/ server with a cook. This is not sufficient to provide even mediocre customer service.  The ugly ~ because the bartender/server was so overwhelmed an older blonde male owner was called in. Big... no... HUGE mistake. Not only is he unfriendly but he has no effing idea wtf to do to help a customer!!! After waiting 15 minutes to cash out with no eye contact from the bartender, we attempted to get the owner's attention. He glanced in our general direction, then hid behind the kitchen door!!! ARE YOU FU***NG kidding me?? You are the owner of a bar/ restaurant and you lack the balls to own up to the poor service your guests are receiving???   The take away ~ though we live just up the street, after today, we will not be returning. Not because of the bartender/ server but because the owner was such a pos.

Fknwxklubkc7WOHCYMs-Cg.text: Came to this place after seeing the reviews and looking at the pictures. When I got their I got seated right away the waiter was very nice, friendly and helpful. Everything I ordered was amazing for the appetizers I ordered the wings and the Thai hummus both amazing and for the main course I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and I loved it. The desert was also amazing bread pudding with brownie in it wow oh and also the beers we're amazing. I will definitely be going back loved it.

4iINUDEBTmvZeh6YqPdUwA.text: This place is amazing!  It's earned a great Yelp rating for a reason.  We arrived one evening and the place was not very busy.  We sat ourselves, then shortly after, a very pleasant lady came with our menus and got our drink orders. I had multiple beer questions and she was more than happy to help me figure out the best option for my tastes.  While we waited for our meals, we played with their supplied games. This made the time pass by so quickly, because it felt like only minutes before our food arrived.  We ordered their "Garbage Fries," and their wings. Both were fabulous! I mean these things had so much flavor, and tasted so fresh. I was thoroughly impressed. I wanted to lick the plate. Haha.  This restaurant really takes care of the customer, even down to the really nice (thick) napkins they provide.  A definite must try!

bkrstdwQVFKm5wG3TagmXQ.text: We went here for birthday brews and we're not disappointed. Lots of choices for new beers to try-had a nice Brett sour, and a maple stout-delicious. at3TnoOCL63F3sLzlq1Ejg.text: Absolutely fantastic service and I had the best pork belly bahn mi and my husband had the tuna burger, which were both so good. We also watched the Knight game which made it even better

CvNjwAxIzmeIgmC5nw1O8g.text: They have a really great beer selection and the food is pretty good. My friends love to go there for a beer and conversation.

ToWqEgPW21AGQa_eY0xiEQ.text: So always had 595 on my radar. Since it was my birthday got to decide the restaurant celebrate with my roommates. Gastropub is there any better spot! You get quality craft beers from small micro brews all around the world and great food. Think not!  My frist impression nothing new reading past reviews was dam walking into dark abyss. We went for early dinner so lot of natural light out. Soon walk in think someone moved the clock forward. I missed cool buffalo head on one of the walls. Thankfully my roommate caught it in the darkness. The rolling garage door on one side that assume better weather might open it up. The bar area is small not many seats but love the way all set up. The whole place is really small. Later in the night once got pack it can get loud. Overall fan of the vibe of the whole look just think weird that the place is so dark.   The craft beer list is TOP NOTCH. I am in no way craft expert but they have lot of beers that hardly see and nice selection from IPA, and list goes on. Our server made two great recommendations based on thinking red ale or new castle style. She like can give you sample of each. She found the perfect beer celebrate my birthday.  The food was awesome!!! It was not planned but got in on some of the HH food. We got three items for appetizers. The Fried Devil Eggs, Beer and Cheese Poutine, and Mini Banh Mi sliders (we got the signature chicken ones; if going get them HH it one per order and basically half size regular size Banh MI). The Devil Eggs never really had them fried traditional size many times. It adds another element with either panko or breadcrumbs coated on the outside. Its nice crispy outside then have perfect hard boiled egg with the filling that creamy, delicious, and addicting cause pop one in mouth just want more. The poutine fries was solid. It interesting that they have five different ones. Not many places serve it so kind of cool seeing few options besides traditional. Honest need try the traditional next go around cause not having brown gravy on it  feel off. Beer and Cheese great combination. The portion size is nice. It definitely made to share cause for one that lot of food. The little Banh Mi slider was winnah winnah chicken dinner. The bread was on point. The bread for me makes or break Banh Mi. The whole sandwich was tasty. The price was great for HH and think about portion size. One of the better HH food menus. My entree had Banh Mi before got HH ones. I got another one but tried the beef brisket one instead. It was really good. But honestly if had choose between the two would go back to the chicken or signature one. The beef brisket felt like little dried out but the filling with the sauce, vegetables, and the bread all good still. Just if had choose not order it again.   The service was awesome. Maybe cause went for early dinner and not as busy. She was very attentive, friendly, made great recommendations on beer selection, and great service. I definitely see myself coming back to try more of the menu. Till the next time...

XVannJWTAHQFLzdhOkhrIg.text: We had a chance to check out this place when our family came to Vegas for Rise festival. I was so impressed with this place cuz its decoration and the food. Their service is supper friendly and attentive. We ordered a lot of different dishes and shared with each other. I'm Vietnamese, and I rarely eat American food. But their food is the BOMB. I think there a combination of Vietnamese style in their American food. That's why I enjoyed all dishes we ordered!!! My favorite are chicken wings with fish sauce and banh mi belly pork. It was too damn good! I would say I was addicted to chicken wings and ordered extra one to eat at the hotel :) Fiends, if you are in Vegas, come and check out this place. You will love it. FOR SURE!!!

FR62fVJ2HxU8BUnl-M7Q9w.text: 595 Craft and Kitchen  Disclaimer alert...I don't drink.  I eat.  That being said, this review is about their food and service.  Overall service was good. Our server was very attentive and our items served quickly. If I had one complaint about the service, it was our server's negative comments about Yelpers. I'm not going into details to what she said.  She basically accused all Yelpers of being unethical. Bottom line, her comments put a bad taste in my mouth. What didn't put a bad taste in my mouth was their Fried Crispy Chicken Skins. This was so good, crispy, tasty, and not greasy.  If there's one food item to get at 595, this is it.  I also tried their Beer Cheese (pretzel bread w/beer cheese) and the Craft Burger.  The beer cheese lacked flavor and the burger was on the salty side.  Actually, I think everything was on the salty side.  Overall, with the exception of the fried chicken skins, everything I tried was just okay.  On the bright side, the pretzel bread and bun was fabulous.  Overall, 595 gets 3 stars from me.  Service is good, their fried chicken skin is excellent, unwarranted comments from our server sucked, and the rest of the food is just "A-Ok".

zb0x9RAws_s5jgYjjbZraA.text: I live in Summerlin and was craving fried chicken skin. I usually make the drive down to the UNLV area, to a Pinoy joint, to get my fix. Being as it was late and I was feeling extra lazy, I decided to find a place that offered it close by.   We ordered pickup and customer service was pleasant. I'm giving two stars based on the food. The chicken skin had too much breading on it and I could barely taste the skin. It literally just tasted like breading. My boyfriend ordered buffalo wings and we could barely taste the buffalo sauce!! It was just fried chicken wings/thighs. I'll take a pass.

UwaNPvZOixSm4jfStfXLBg.text: Fun variety on the menu - bread pudding never disappoints - exceptional friendly staff - always great fun at 595!!

f7Epvjlqlti5q5frtQNjcA.text: If I can rename this restaurant, I would call it "Salt". Everything I ordered was salty, except for the water I ordered.  My order: Pork Belly burger, fries and the crafty popcorn. I don't recommend the popcorn - salty and not that great tasting. The burger was good - it helped that there was lettuce and onions in the burger to balance the salty infusion of pork belly and burger meat and sauce. The fries - salty.   I had to drink a full glass of water after my meal to get the salty taste out of my mouth. Hubby ordered a beer so our bill was around $30.

o2gb4ennFBzmb1sbIpeiEA.text: I have mixed feelings of this place so I'll list them basically through pros and cons.  Pros: The warm buratta cheese dip is AMAZING! It comes with crispy pita and chips (a variety with some being salty and some being bland). The staff is friendly and easy going. Great selection of beers especially since they have some sour ales (a favorite of mine!)  Cons: The table was messy like sticky messy. Whoever is cleaning kind of need to be aware of that. The seating area was small so if you have a party of more than 4 be aware because you may need to grab two tables. Burgers were just mediocre which is negative because if in paying 10-15$ for a burger I expect it to be different than whataburger. Not bad but nothing special. Fries are 7$??.... that seems kinda high to me but that's my opinion.  Overall dinner cost 60$ for two people getting burgers ... too pricy in my opinion. I'd check it out simply because of the beer selection though!

W0RkC0OUpzAIY9JYluZmzA.text: This is a hidden gem. They have such a great combination of delicious Asian inspired food, and a great beer selection. We brought a table of seven and ended up passing around all of our meals because they were all so tasty! The staff is very knowledgeable and the food service was quick. All the food I would order again. The pork belly is the best thing there, no matter what you order it on, such as a sandwich or burger. It is basically the highest quality bar food that I've had in any recent memory.  We ended up spending around 130$ for 7 people

H5B8gwJczmZlM7Ta5rWKMw.text: OK very important spot. I don't even want it to grow in popularity because I want it to be mine and only mine. But that's selfish; this place deserves applause.   Me and my girlfriend have pronounced 595 as our numero UNO favorite bar/gastropub in town. It hits all the buttons and makes for a great experience consistently every time. Upon 5 visits I find more reasons to love the spot and plan on making a habit on coming more.   The food is SO DARN GOOD. Perhaps the biggest distinguishing factor of this spot. True personality dashed on each dish, it's really hard to go wrong anywhere on the menu. The Vietnamese fusion of classy gastropub dishes is evident throughout the menu and makes for tough selection every time. So far our hands down favorites are that ridiculous dynamite dip (R U kidding this idea is gold) and the banh mi (classic, porkbelly WHATEVA). The beer selection is great too I always try a new IPA every time I stop in!  One of the biggest reasons for our returning is the consistently amazing service and company of the bartenders, especially Charles. That guy is truly awesome, remembered us after our first visit and is so welcoming every time we come back. He balances his dope company with solid service like a True professional and really completes the whole visit. Thank you Charles and thank you 595 for being such an awesome lil joint for us to loiter!

V_aBAYmWlluTqReunB-zkg.text: Came here for happy hour and it was pretty well worth it. Tried a couple of things off the menu.  Tried both the original banmi slider and the chicken one. I'm not sure which was which because the server didn't tell us, but I think I liked the original one. One of our sandwiches took about 30 minutes to come out after the all the other food, so we were literally just sitting there waiting for it. When I saw slider, I thought it would come with a couple like how you usually see with sliders, but it just came with 1. I honestly think I could have skipped this.  fried chicken skins: Delicious, but I would go between "omg this is so good," and then realize I'm eating pure fat and think "omg I can't keep eating this." It's very interesting dish and they give you a lot. I would recommend it, just don't think too much about what it is because you really forget it's chicken skins. I was a big fan of the chili sauce.  fried deviled eggs: Pretty self-explanatory. I liked the sauce it came with.  The service wavered between super helpful to "I can't even get a glass of water." I literally had to try and just keep my hand up to get her attention for some water. We also had to ask for our last sandwich twice before it came.

uyWExDtxyrFlQcaoaM2HFQ.text: The food was excellent and the service was great.  The hot chicken sandwich is just that, very spicy.  The Nachos were great and the atmosphere was fun.  Clean bathrooms.

E3jkG3JMyuya-m77aY9Tyg.text: Sitting in a quaint plaza on Tropicana and rainbow, the restaurant emblazoned 595 sticks out from behind the chevron. With a rustic bar look, the place is very casual, selling their interesting beer menu look.  The staff was friendly, easily asking any questions I had.  The food was great too! Would I come back though? Probably not. Their menu is very similar to many Vietnamese fusion places in town, but with different quirks, such as poutine. The restaurant puts out a wide variety of dishes; while all delicious, are not to the level of similar restaurants such as District One or Bachi Burger. Take this with a grain of salt since these are just my taste buds preferring a less "hearty" menu.  The place is delicious to try if you are in the mood, however I believe there are current just better options than 595.

6k8dm9FdIMZD0g-ak0ufSA.text: I love it here! This is definitely my type of bar. Since I'm not too knowledgeable about what kind of beers I like, I asked the bartender for recommendations and he gave me a couple different options to taste to find which one I want to commit to. I've been here a few different times and each time I had a different style of beer that I really liked! Their taps are constantly rotating but I know that there's always going to be something I'll like when I come. I give them a ton of props for bringing more craft beer to Vegas!  Now onto the munchies! There are so many good things on the menu that I love.   For appetizers I highly recommend the fried deviled eggs and the chicken skins. Both are super addicting!   For main dishes all the banh mis are fiiirrree. If you don't know what a banh mi is, crawl out from under that rock and welcome to the best sandwich you've ever had. The hot fried chicken sandwich is also everything I've ever wanted in a chicken sandwich. Make sure to ask for the home made buttermilk (ranch) dressing for your sandwich and fries. It's bomb diggity.   Right now they have a pumpkin spice bread pudding that makes you forget it's still 80 degrees in October. I also love that it comes with home made whipped cream on top.   TL:DR Come for the craft beer selection; stay for the sandwiches!

iIIMHGR2zFZ4aWFi0_7THg.text: Let's see waiter went to group that came in after us -- they received water and we didn't - hmmmm will finish review based on the rest of service - waiter came by to check on us - I initially asked the gentlemen for water for my child and he never returned with it - the girl is good and pays attention to detail - one more star so far - okay food came out and it is good - burger tasted great - wings excellent and the girl server saved you stars today - good job - I will return- 4 stars because of how the beginning  but remember the girl aced the day - good help is hard to find !

fEkyhaSPkeEefleCcSLf7Q.text: I've been dying to come try this place! It's on the corner of trop and rainbow. The interior is very gastropub and it's so beautiful.   The prices were mouth dropping, affordable pricing but such quality with the food. I had the burger, tuna burger, and poutine. When I lived in Canada all I did was sample poutine and 595's is very very authentic tasting. They just need to add more cheese curds and they'll be solid! The burger and tuna was cooked to upmost perfection. Weird that I paid 2$ for ONE slice of bacon on my burger though.  Drinks ordered Mother Earth beer, powderfinger and after the gold rush. The after the gold rush drink was disgusting and the server was so so nice to me and offered his own drink called the Trinidad sour. THANK YOU ERIC! He was literally psychic because I didn't complain about my drink and he knew i didn't like it. Eric gave me the best service I've ever received at a bar/restaurant. He kept my water filled and kept checking on me to make sure everything was delicious. My mother earth was perfect. Great service, drinks, and food! I will be back :)  Btw it's confusing bc I didn't know if it was open seating and none of the servers had a uniform on

RezJ_SVSaZIodcxwXHk_WQ.text: Great Beer, great food. Definitely a winner. Stagg was nice and friendly. Great place to check out. Vibes are on point.

wfdYhaEUIz-zuFXJkAocmA.text: I love a good beer so we decided to come check out this new place near our home. They have a great selection of beers on tap. I tried the pineapple flavored beer which was a little too sweet for my taste but still drinkable. As far as food, the deviled eggs are a must try, the fried chicken burger was awesome, and the bahn mi sandwich was pretty good as well. They just opened a couple months ago so they seem to be finding their groove. Service was a little slow but the place was packed so it's understandable. There was also a lot of confusion with food orders. A few dishes came out to our table that we're meant for other tables but we told them we didn't order them and they figured it out. There's a few menu items we still want to try so we'll be back sometime soon.

BfdgKfb22jJhr4_Ky-hQ1g.text: The food is surprisingly delicious.  Burgers are juicy and the chicken skins are a must try!!  Drinks are also very good!!

_FvYhL1ghyH0HTfLsbGvKw.text: Amazing beers, real craft selection not like pulling bluemoon and goose IPA. Love that every time a keg kicks they dont put same thing on.

nupmtZkpstbsR0X0rMZAOw.text: Great choice of beers and food is great. Bartender is a good guy and was willing to do tasters.

NV6lx7sA69hKGzNMhfuV7A.text: Amazing service!!!! Great beer selection and service with a smile! We're from out of town and got great advice from a very friendly bartender. Food was very good and fast. I would recommend this place to anyone!!! Ask for Bozo, he is awesome!

uJZrUlhkiBBkg-DDqpLk1w.text: My husband and I came in on a Monday night to have a few beers and snacks. Beer was great and the food was above average. I'd heard about the hummus being pretty great but wasn't really head over heels about it. The wings were just so-so as well. The loco moco fries though, they were excellent and even let us add a slice of pork belly on top. For dessert, we shared the pudding and it was great except for the peanut oil that is drizzled on the plate...that's not a good flavor combination. I suggest honey or anything else but peanut oil. Place wasn't very busy, cooks and staff seemed bored. Very clean establishment, clean bathrooms and adequate space. Since this sits on the corner of Tropicana and Rainbow, I'd hope that they continue to get more business.

Z8u9m_cfNtrBrAYAIJPbAg.text: Been going there for a couple months, brought tons of friends to this new establishment.  Knowing its a new restaurant, it's going to have it's moments.   Great beer selection and great bartenders/staff.  Menu looks promising for the most part.  One day, I went there by myself after work and I had an order of chicken wings that didn't agree with me.  I noticed it was bloody inside, sent it back to the kitchen and they voided it.  Mind you, I work in a restaurant on the strip and using a thermometer prior to sending out an order of chicken wings will save you the headache.  I had chicken wings here before and when it's not busy without no issues. Things happen when your busy with happy hour and it being a newer restaurant.  Please don't justify your not wrong by telling the server/bartender to tell you the temperature it came out after my wings were served bloody inside.  If you have a oven and a warmer, please pre bake your wings in the oven, hold it in a warmer, and then fry the wings to order will solve that issue. Logistic and temperature issues solved especially when your busy during happy hour.  I really like this place, but after this incident I think I'll eat at home to be safe.

k0OQNVPNH3qnbxxUv08y-A.text: Really want to love this place......but it's just a bit to pricey. Amazing beer selection, many from local breweries. Many hard to find styles of beer. Having said that, they are all over priced just like all alcohol in Vegas. We are no where near the strip or DTLV...why should an IPA cost $7? For the sours and beer styles that cost a lot more, and more time to make I understand paying up for a beer....but this is a little much.  While the food is innovative and has great concept, execution  is lacking or just isn't as great as we would hope. We have been several times already because of location, and every time I feel like we spent to much money, more than we planned. I have no problem spending good money on great food and craft beer...but we are just a little let down by 595.

SBwzuSMzwkxdPoRaaJfefw.text: Been waiting for this to open and it finally happened! All the food I saw looked great! I had the Fried Chicken Skins and the Chili, both were great! They're using local sourced where they can, like Butcher Block down the street. Tap list was seriously impressive with a wide variety of True Craft brands and styles. I ticked a few off my list last night. Next time I'm going for a burger, hearing good things about them, "each bite is like biting into a steak". I gotta experience that. I would probably had been happy with either great beer selection or mediocre beer selection and good food but we're getting stellar efforts of both! Bravo and see you next time!

PEZpNrEUmYJ1ON2uGQs4EQ.text: First time checking out this spot and we will definitely come back again! Fried devil egg was amazing! This bar actually had a lot of beers that the local bars do not carry. Finally an intimate craft beer/food place that's not over crowded or some chain restaurant. The manager Van was super nice along with his two bartenders. They suggested awesome drinks and they greeted & said goodbye to every customer that walked in/out! You don't get that kind of service anymore! Can't wait till the weather cools off to sit outside and have a drink!

y1LgL-TQ34UU52n2lhOE9g.text: Fantastic food and great beer list.  The Furikake Tuna Burger is epic and the Pork Belly Burger is about as good as you could imagine.  Go for the side of House Fries--hot, crispy and juicy with a fry sauce that has a delightful kick. Did we mention the beer list?! We'll be back soon!

INvuDMOv83CXLDgOskdqBQ.text: PERFECT 10! Food is outstanding you can't go wrong here. I was in town for business and running last minute errands that luckily brought me near 595 Craft plenty of brews on tap as good as any high end Vegas strip eatery. My compliments to the Chef.

HRQg_mg3ZPvB2ov_phAV3A.text: Damn that poutine is delicious!!! I will definitely be coming back for this again the next time I'm in Vegas!!!

Gps0IbeEX10S4J2xtC3I_Q.text: I typically eat a little more healthy than what's going on at this place but the food was pretty good when I had a burger and fries. I will say that the reason for the 5 stars is actually the bartender. He was awesome and gave us some good tips for betting on the Mayweather fight.

zg0yqv9Xw_yOMjUqHXxDkQ.text: Went there for lunch. Super chill atmosphere and feels like a "Cheers" bar where everyone will know your name. Got the wings (the honey fish sauce one, can't spell the actual name haha) and they were delicious. I typically like my wings more crisp, but they hit the spot. Shared fries with the dude. HUGE serving and the sauces were great (fry sauce and garlic aioli). Dude got the brisket banh mi and he raved about it. So much potential for this little gem - thanks for opening literally a minute from where I live.

6xJMiP32PBOoZz81zbbsVQ.text: Incredible food and the staff was just as good. Was in town from San Diego with some friends for a spartan race and went here after for food and drinks. We order quite a few food items to share. The melted cheese dip with pretzel bites was amazing as well as the bahn mi sandwich. The  craft beer selection is perfectly paired with the food items they serve. This restaurant is an essential addition for the Las Vegas community. You will not be disappointing!

L9ifXzNBLIlXVgN90rmuyQ.text: We live close by so thought we would try it out since I saw poutine. I'm Canadian so thought I'd try it but it was not as expected. I ordered the traditional poutine and signature banh mi. Gravy just wasn't for me. The banh mi was salty, not sure if it was the mayo or the daikon (those should be sweet and tangy vinegar like). Staff were great and nice atmosphere but I'd rather stick to my pho place style banh mi which would be half the price and taste better.

QkczmDAExVLHbcNJvQm2sw.text: Probably my 10th time here. Gets better everytime. I have had a majority of the food. It's all great. I think the deviled eggs are a bit expensive for what you get... but they are still fire(really good). Hot fried chicken sandwich is my favorite sandwich and the hoisin sambal beer chicken wings are dank(even better). Beer and cider taps are epic and I always finish with a somtging out of there broad whiskey selection. High west campfire was tonight's selection. Kasey is the best. Then there is a really sweet Irish girl who's name I forget. But point blank period. Food, drinks and service is off the chain.

HKfdduM1LpbIH86bz5yyWA.text: The beers were pretty good but the food and service was very average. My burger was pretty undercooked for a medium well. I think the biggest drawback is how small it is. If you like to be tight with your table next to you then it's probably ok. I just wish they had actual menus for the beers on tap because I couldnt really make out the board with my crappy contacts.

u3YM1Mzkt5_jv9H_sK7s-w.text: Deep fried chicken skins and deep fried bedeviled eggs plus craft beer.  Excellent find.  No smoking and no gambling, don't tell anyone.  Excellent service from the girl from Montana.

T5nPcw-qRL0RDvSEAlq-JQ.text: Getting 5 stars from me is easy when a place does the simple things right.  595 is an owner operated business with a great Staff, great service (I sat at the bar), tasty well executed bar food (I had the Chicken sandwich, the deviled eggs, the cashew hummus and the house chili) and a bunch of really tasty beers and cocktails.  That's it, what else can you ask for. I will upload pictures later. Also check out Meraki Grill next door it's amazing.

JNHOKqYwZp4Z7R-7LWx3rg.text: Cool small local hangout good craft beers & food is very good. Bartenders were nice & attentive will be back soon.

olcpL122te9hCsjkOMplTg.text: Not really impressed with this place at all.  Went for HH and the prices were not very "happy". Either we're the servings.  The food was good. But not a very good bargain. Especially since the place was empty. Maybe if they worked on the HH it wouldn't be.

RZUfH_nB3xdGkKQWXMjXYA.text: Came here on a Sunday evening.    I had the noodle salad topped with egg and seared pork belly.  My friend and I also shared the popcorn of-the-day: kochujang and honey.    The popcorn was a little overly "wet" or mushy which I guess was to be expected when mixing it with honey and spicy bean paste.  But we did not get a choice on what kind of popcorn we wanted.  After about halfway in, it became too salty for our palate.  I understand the need to be unique and the blending of flavors, but to me it did not work.  The "noodle salad" was reminiscent of the Vietnamese "bun" dishes at any pho restaurant.  I thought the chef might have been going for some type of fusion--so naturally I expected more melding of differing flavors East and West.  I saw none of that.  It really looked like an imitation of a pricier and less authentic bun dish.  The noodles used were a bit stiffer and slightly chewier than the vermicelli used in pho restaurants.  Despite the menu's description, it didn't taste any better.   It also got saltier towards the bottom of the bowl.  In a pho restaurant you can add as much of the sweet/savory nam pla as you want, but here it's added when prepped.  It's also more saltier than your traditional nam pla fish sauce.    The pork belly was cooked fairly well--tender and semi-moist.    They had 1 waitress and 1 or 2 bartenders.  Service got slow when the relatively small dining area filled up to about 50-75% capacity.  We were checked up on once after the main course was dropped.   I didn't use the bathrooms, but my friend said they were very clean and immaculate.    No dessert offered and I can't remember if anything was on the menu.  But we went to the Fluff Ice down the road on Russell and Rainbow.

4l2aBslf5ZrfbDmti2JDXw.text: If you like beer this is your spot! Constantly rotating beer on tap and always unique finds. The food is great as well, their fried deviled eggs are by far the most phenomenal thing you have tasted, creative twist on a deviled egg and so worth a couple orders ;-). Tristian and Kasey are amazing, they are the only staff I have really interacted with since I always make it a point to stop in and say hi to these lovely folks. They are fun, welcoming, knowledgeable, personable, and know how to connect the patrons at their bar to make for a lively social setting. I have met some really awesome people at 595! Great little gem here in Vegas, that's for sure! Do yourself a favor and stop by next time you're on this side of town grab a cold beer and an order of the fried deviled eggs!!

916Aaf_ckq9cFnRhLTOChQ.text: Apparently just opened 6 days ago. Excellent selection of craft beers on tap plus a full bar. The fusion food was absolutely delicious and the sauces were fantastic. The food prices are a little high for the quantity but the flavors were excellent. The fries were the best we have ever had. A bunch of dishes have extra add ons, but it worth it. The fried deviled eggs were very tasty but you only get 4 halves for $9. The spring rolls were super tasty but the wrap could have been much tighter and not so messy. The noodle salad was small but a great flavor especially if you add pork belly. The chicken wings were crispy and juicy. We had the sauce on the side since we didn't know the hoisin and sambal was going to be awesome. Though the chicken sandwich was our least favorite, it was still very good. The food seems to come one at a time and the seating is a free for all. The place is not very big and it filled up fast. Oh, don't let them take your sauces as they clear each plate. We dipped our fries in all the sauces.

DVWdM6TtpsmAs_jQ4ZF6xg.text: This was a nice place to have a beer and watch sports. Waitress was very nice and helpful with ordering food and drinks. The price was low with happy hour specials while the game was on. I'll come back in the future.

KhqLUNnbYitf1sH5jP4iBQ.text: This place is great for beer no doubt about it. Food was good but wasn't great. We ordered some chicken wings and the texture felt undercooked, they explained that is because they braised them so they are extra juicy,  my husband and I just didn't like the texture and felt undercooked. Everything else as far as food was good. I loved the music and the devil eggs.

jq4nKijdLUAYwnu8cTpm0g.text: Came here for lunch because Miraki the Greek  kabob place was so busy.  The bar with a vast selection of draft beers looks interesting,  but came in for a quick lunch. The waitress got our drink order then after we decided on our lunch choices, we waited to order and waited and waited... She clearly is playing the "I'm busy" game. Yes, she is by herself in the dining area, but with 3 other tables occupied it's not New years eve in there. She is busing tables and ignoring us Priority is to take our order and as we are waiting she can bus a table, but no we didn't exist.  I finally got up and asked her to attend to us. She acted surprised like 'oh you want to eat?" I guess the food was ok, the crab dip was oily and no good. Everything else was average, but the waitresses attitude spoiled the lunch. Left a basic tip because of her poor service. What causes this? I have no idea. I will wait in line at the Greek place next time.

iinCjP55NnLW-yOzKTy9hA.text: Just walked out of there with an order to go-salad greens w/tasty grilled chicken w/citrus dressing  and HOLY SHIT BALLS it's good! I think I LOVE that place now lol!  Cool owners Good vibes  And obviously GOOD chef!

IE39agNHfU0K-Hs9w8cAnA.text: We were visiting from Seattle and stopped in for a craft beer, and found a scratch kitchen to boot. I had the buffalo wings, which were delicious, and my wife had a side of chili, which was also delicious. Great friendly service, and great food just a few blocks from our son's house. We'll definitely be back when we visit again.

K2cCV76x0cpSC_nRaFKmNA.text: Went in with a group of friends, our food didn't come out quick and we waited for almost 45 minutes! Other than the wait, everything else was pretty tasty and fresh, try their hangover fries. It's a little cozy bar/restaurant away from the strip with a great drink menu.

_LLmyaZJTtvkhztwEtEdvg.text: Total dumper, arrived last Sunday to try this place out. I would give no stars if allowed.  We noted the good reviews on Yelp.... must be bogus. We stood at the front door, while it appeared workers were outside talking, finally was acknowledged and seated at a table. no water no menu for what like 20 minutes. Asked about beers, she told us she didn't KNOW about beers and she would get someone. WTH... a guy server arrived he did not know anything about beer selection. Finally got a menu, and it was a limited food selection... WTH we looked up the menu because we have two vegetarians with us. We asked what was going on and she said it's a Pup UP, where they loan the place out to a different chef. Staff was clearly clueless, had no idea what was going on, asked for the same beer 5 times no one would bring it. These people were brain dead, would ask for napkins and they could not remember to bring them. We thought we were in a time warp... A 5 year old could have done better, we will not come back. I do not know how you Loan your business out and let people who have no idea how to serve, how to explain the menu, what the beer menu is. This is a crazy business plan.

lgg_NWuZlvBBLD46_0Fv6w.text: Great service and good food!!! Loved the atmosphere!   The staff was excellent. When I arrived with a friend there were no tables available. The staff promptly identified this and gave us options until a table was available. Shortly after, a couple came in and sat at the table we were waiting for; a different employee quickly took note and courteously had them move, then sat us down.   The food was better than expected and the atmosphere resembles what I would compare to Portland OR. Very nice change of pace.

hcgipEeyTfel4iT6ObCmkw.text: Came here tonight for dinner. Saw on yelp it is a recently opened business and wanted to try something new. Inside the ambience is casual and the first thing you see when you walk in is a bar area go the right and then seating area to the left.   It's self seating and the bar was full so we chose to sit in a small table for four. It took a little while to get our drink order. I ordered an apricot cider which was a bit sour but good. My glass had some lipstick stain on it and I was not wearing any lipstick so I had to send it back unfortunately. The waitress was very apologetic and was happy to get me a new glass.   The food was good. We got fried chicken skins and dynamite crab dip for appetizers. The crab dip was pretty good and had a kick to it. The chicken skins were good and reminded me of calamari but everyone on yelp raved about it so far so we had to give it a try.   I ordered the signature banh mi. It was okay. Not the banh mi I'm used to but the bread was soft which I liked. My husband got a pork belly burger and he ate that all up.   Overall, we had a good experience and will most likely come back to try other things on their menu.the random Buffalo head adds a nice touch to the place since it's the only decoration they have on the wall.

qZuv0qhM-E-A-jAGyrmTaA.text: Best burger everrrrr. Get the pork belly burger then add the crab dip inside of it. Take a bite and you will understand. Hands down best craft burger I've ever tasted.

KbbStTnYcBBDhssUDFmwwQ.text: Great variety in the selection of craft beer! It was great to taste anything I wanted but a lot of the beers tasted a little... off... first one was so odd I almost questioned if the tap lines were dirty. I did end up finding a few pints to drink so maybe it was my taste buds that were funky that night (to be fair). We asked to watch a UFC fight and ended up feeling guilty for wanting to watch it- the bartender was pretty passive aggressive in communicating that it wasn't something she wanted on the tv (which was a bummer because other bar guests ended up watching and enjoying with us!) Food was interesting but not delicious. In fairness we knew the food options and still chose to try the place based on the beer. With all the options in town, we won't go back.

dOa98gmUd9SgLJ3_QlJjhw.text: Good prices, good drinks, good food. But it's nothing grand to write home about. The only fave was the crab dip. It was weird tho to add fries with my burger for $3 while the burger didn't have enough flavor IMO. Patty was thick but not juicy. Expected better!  *Updating after owner's response: I submitted my review too hastily that I forgot to mention my husband got the Signature Banh Mi and he loved it! Bread was softly toasted (not hard and crunchy where traditional Vietnamese do it), and he said the loaded meat portion and unique pickled taste was well done! Glad it came from a Vietnamese owner who knows how to do it correctly at an American place, and better than most Vietnamese places. I'm leaving it at 3 stars bc as vacationers and our first and only visit, it was average. Not bad, not great overall. I appreciate the Asian fusion with the American vibe and your reason for offering the fries/salad extra to avoid waste. We were there for a late dinner earlier this week. Too bad I expected a juicier burger. The caramelized onions saved it. Hope the team doesn't keep missing the mark!

ZhNRW6eEMtg5HQ7bi4R2fA.text: Came here on a suggestion from a bartender at a nearby place. We came around 4:30 on 420. They had a lot of specials for 420 with 4.20 beers. We sat at the bar and were greeted by the bartender. The service was okay. I felt like because we ordered regular cocktails  it wasn't the full on craft experience. We had trouble with some of the ingredients on the menu and the bartender helped us out but I felt like she was annoyed. No biggie we ordered our drinks Queen Bee, Daquiri and the C + E. The drinks were good. Really strong. There happy hour menu was pretty good. We ordered the spicy crab dip. The dip was a 10. Served with crackers and pita bread. Will definitely be coming back for the food!

tpUI9l0lUQAuY0deMQrEBA.text: Great selection of bitter beers. Nothing in the German or Bavarian style. The Thai bami sandwich was very small very disappointing, shame. Burgers are the thing at this place. Service depends on how crowded they are. We were there in a very crowded day.

CvZiMmnZ3COlc2knLAyyeQ.text: This place is chill , not your ordinary food but the 4 things we tried was good . Fried deviled egg, crispy cauliflower, hot spicy chicken burger , whoosh it was spicy !! And tuna burger. The beer selection is unique and not your average everyday beers , great selection of specialty brews. The only thing I wish they have deferent would be an actual beer list . They have their beer list on chalkboard that hanging behind bar , and it's very hard for ppl like me without perfect vision to read , but I did found their online menu so overall was excellent place to hang out !

x8UaM2nvM_C8-f4DZml8Vw.text: 595 Craft And Kitchen is just a couple minutes away from my house, so my boyfriend and I like to come here late nights after he gets off work to grab a beer and some food. They have a good selection of drinks and the food is delicious! My favorite thing on the menu is the fries with the buffalo chicken on top and their fried deviled eggs.   The service is usually pretty good. However the past few times that we have tried to go past 12am, they're already closed. One time, I called 10 mins before coming, to ask what time they were closing and they said 2 am. After arriving, I noticed the doors were locked. I called again and the same woman picked the phone up and said they just closed. 10 mins after speaking with her!!! Although it isn't a far drive, it is still pretty disappointing to show up and the place is closed. Maybe they should change their hours of operation on Yelp or something?

H9DaKB4zlgokUMpmWOEcbg.text: This was a nice hole in the wall. I'm looking to go again because I did not get to try the beers.  The lunch special was on point. The menu was small however the portions were great.   The guys that were working were extremely friendly. The paid attention to my needs with my glass never running out of my beverage of choice.   The whole place was small to medium but it was extremely clean. I would've gave it 5 stars but I don't give those out a lot. Great job with this place and you will get my business soon.

Qfr6_QZL6uixwdVWEOCLwA.text: Love this place! If you want high quality food and drinks, chill atmosphere, great service  and TVs to watch, you've come to the right place! Prices are not bad, not cheap, yet you get what you pay for. I'd rather pay more to eat well.   I came to eat by myself on a late Sunday night, and Tristan, the server was very welcoming! I ordered a water and hot water, mentioned how I was feeling it a little in my throat, and she brought back this magical mix of hot water, honey, lemon, mint and ginger syrup. It was delicious, almost like a hotty toddy, mint mojito drink for a sore throat. She read my mind! Tristian was also helpful with helping me decide what to eat and what to expect.   I got the house popcorn, which was furakaki that day, fried deviled eggs and house bhan mi. All was so good! It was a good portion, but since I was hungry, I finished it! Popcorn was perfectly flavored, not too strong or salty. Great to munch on. I've eaten  a lot of Bhan Mis, but this was one of the best! The baguette was warm, but not overly toasted, meat was tender and filling was flavorful. The fried deviled eggs was crispy, yet the yolk was smooth. I would definitely come back, bring friends and I highly Recommend this place!   Pros: Service  Tasty High quality food and drinks  Cool, hip, trendy, chill place  Clean resturant and bathroom  Cons: None

XRx8h8v_wP_S1yNDv8L-zw.text: Great place for beer and food!  A frequently rotating beer list with a mix of local favorites and microbrews around the country that you might not see anywhere else.  Also very good food selection, enjoyable relaxed atmosphere, and friendly staff.  Definitely worth a visit.

XxrquqF6JbJS76-dCzRFUQ.text: This was definitely my first time coming here, maybe partially because they're still fairly new.  The location isn't too far for me and the best part there is plenty of parking. I was a little bummed because I couldn't partake in drinking, they have a pretty good selection of crafted beers and cocktails. I will definitely be coming back for some sangria.   After observing the menu and getting feed back on the food, I decided I definitely wanted to try the Deep fried devil eggs and Vermicelli Noodle salad, they said the dressing would be worth it. Boy was he right Themis salad was so good, the dressing amplified the greens and I am a sucker for noodles.  I would definitely recommend the salad and the Deviled eggs was a good starter, it had a unique flavor and the textures was good, I even try dipping it In my dressing and it was soooooo good.  Another recommendation was the bread pudding of the day- so of course I had to jump in dessert, the current flavor was Reese Peanut Butter cup, and boy was it good, I loved the cream and sauce m, it was a perfect balance and it was moist and not soggy, so the texture and flavor was in point. I just wish I could finish it, but sadly it's meant to share. Overall, I enjoyed the food and the atmosphere. The staff super friendly and very knowledgeable, they will definitely give you some good recommendations. The quality of food is delicious and good, they definitely take pride on providing fresh and high quality ingredients.

tTltmNCL1dEsAJ6Z_UXSOg.text: Cool atmosphere. Lots of craft drinks. All rotating taps. Great for craft beer fans.   However; while the food is good (and orders are done correctly) I don't think what you get is worth the price. Garbage fries are tasty and should be designed to share. Reasonably speaking I've had bigger portions of carne asada fries for less. If the prices can drop by a buck or two OR portion sizes increase I think the balance will be achieved.

se89d6bw-S7JIdqkQVoTRw.text: The hardest part is finding places that accommodate large parties. I came here with 12 people in my group for my birthday. They don't do reservations but I gave a head notice cuz of how big my party was.   Not only was the manager Van accommodating, we loved our server. I don't remember her name. Sorry! She was really sweet and upbeat. I almost thought she was gonna cream me with my birthday cake. Lmao. But my friend had already done that -_-.  I got the Bahn Mi special. People said they don't toast this but it is toasted. It's just lightly toasted, it's not rock hard like Lee's sandwich. But a little extra toasty would give it the right texture. Flavor was good however my friends had a hard time because of how spicy it was.   I loved it because I'm always asking for extra jalapenos. But if you're not digging the spicy, I'd suggest asking for none. I had two in mine and it was pretty kicking.   I also ordered the poutine! It was so good! I haven't had it since I was in Vancouver. But it was just delicious! I honestly wanted to eat all of it but I was too full.   My friend got the crab dip that we shared. It was with imitation crab. I think this was my least favorite item.   I also had ordered a queen bee. It was so yummy I had to have two! I think all their drinks hit the spot with my group. And our server recommended some drinks to everyone!   Thank you for accommodating us and making our dining experience fun to the staff!

sGD6FmdTBHnSiRCHZ5oIAg.text: Stopped by here out of necessity and was so pleasantly surprised. Place is clean, has good beer selection and food.  -pork belly burger was one of the best I have ever had.  -friend chicken sandwich my wife had was also delicious.

4wDE56oG6siPGqgAa0fylA.text: Garbage nachos were a hit for my kids, a little bit small considering the price but plenty for my two boys with smaller appetites.   We also tried the pretzel with cheese. They must bake them fresh. So tasty.  I had the vermicelli salad with pork belly. It was delicious!! Highly recommend .  The dressing was good but I think I might have preferred a peanut sauce or a little of both!   Peanut butter bread pudding with chocolate whipped cream was super fresh but I think the chocolate flavor  was a little too light for my taste since the peanut butter flavor was so strong.   Overall 4.5 stars! Service was also great!

DGRXjbBaAS9upuuqYNqEVA.text: Get the deviled eggs, you'll thank yourself later. Nice tap lineup and a frequent rotation. Looks like I've found another place to add to my LAS list.

PIBOSF3BoTXdYCLwr4H4gA.text: Great atmosphere! The prices are reasonable and the beverage selection is top notch. I enjoyed all of the food we ordered, but keep in mind that some of the items would be more suited to a tapas style order (deviled eggs pretzels with beer cheese etc.). I highly recommend this place. While it can be a bit loud during peak hours it is still very enjoyable. There is a patio that is suited well for a large (10 person) group and the inside can seat a medium (4-6 person) group comfortably. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and beer selections. I will definitely be back.

Vy_JDjRSTYc_T6oy23jW9g.text: The vibe of this place is pretty cool.   I love the huge list of craft beers written on the wall.   There is a huge selection to choose from which can be daunting but also exciting to get something you've never had before.   The food was pretty average in terms of bar food.  I really liked that they try to make it funky and fun but I think the execution is off.   For example, the fried chicken skin and the crab dip were so salty that even my beer couldn't tame the salt but the cabbage salad was seriously lacking in flavor.   That item was close to being my favorite if it only had some seasoning or pizzazz.     I was surprised at the portion size of everything.  They were very large for the pricing in my opinion.   The service was ok too.   You seat yourself which is fun but it also means you wait a hot second for the server especially if it's busy.   Also I think there might have only been one server plus the bartender so we did have to wait for drink refills and the check.   However, I will say that our server was awesome when we did see her.

3xo4o64_5j8WclV1W51X2Q.text: Came here a few weeks ago with an outta town friend and had a few brews and grub...pretty limited space in there but we found a seat @ the bar and were unexpectedly entertained by my man Carrot Top at the end of the bar !!...good atmosphere, service and solid food at a reasonable price....check'em out if you're in the area

-GvXQVXlheEVMDEI2B42uQ.text: Food was good, beer menu was excellent but we had a serious problem with the bartender... Bad attitude, inattentive service and basically on ignore the whole time.   I liked everything else about it but in a town with so many great options I won't go back.

fGsYxiBcArLpNQbGwj7x5g.text: Came in here for lunch yesterday and ended up getting the spicy chicken sandwich and a side of the fries with the traditional gravy. Ow so good!!!  The chicken sandwich had a sauce that was very unique. It tasted like the hot Nashville chicken from KFC! But better.  I didn't drink bc it being my lunch hour, but there seemed to be quite the selection of beers and drinks on the board. The wait was above average for the crowd that was in there but giving the quality of the food I'm okay with that. Can't wait to come back and try some of the other things on the menu as the other burgers that they had listed looked pretty intriguing as well.

JKQENXd8ZrfqEwfdVnHWHw.text: I first want to say a huge thank you to Van and his staff. I hosted my baby shower here and he was so great! Everyone was so accommodating and he kept saying "I just want everyone to have a great time." So thankful I chose this venue to celebrate with my friends and family, couldn't ask for a better outcome. Not only did everyone enjoy the great food and drinks, but the staff was incredible and friendly. Thank you again Van and everyone for making our day great!

wdrDrM9HTvQYMaohRjEEdw.text: Two Words: Beer Me  I love the vibes and decor here - industrial, modern design. I was greeted by the bartenders and you could tell that they were really proud to work there. I came here for lunch and it was also happy hour.   I ordered the "bad ass" poutine which is spicy chili, smoked bacon, cheese, and beer on top of crispy fries. It is definitely spicy, but nothing I couldn't handle.   The Vietnamese spring roll is a classic and I love how they made it. Fresh ingredients.  They have an array of beer, and they even let you test a few! I ordered quite a few, I cant remember which ones. So, I guess you'd have to stop in to try! I met Van, the owner, when he served me one of my beers. He is a great guy. Can't wait to go back again!

GD9z4IV75REIKTURC1-M9A.text: A small bar with big tasty bites! Walked in on a whim Friday for lunch and both the fried deviled eggs and Nashville hot chicken were jaw-droppingly delicious! The staff was friendly and accommodating. The beer and cocktail menu looked wonderful. Looking forward to a weekend night visit.

J6kH8Nyl_DuCSTiaHdKNHg.text: A cute little gastropub with a downtown LV feel in the southwest side of town, yes please. My friend told me about this place after recently finding it and loving it. We decided to go for a drink and bite to eat on a Friday around 7 pm. The place was PACKED, but luckily we were able to snag two bar seats in the corner.  The service was a little spotty. It took a while to place our drink order and get menus, but I'm assuming it's because they're new and not entirely organized. Food wise I had the Signature Banh Mi which was amazing. The flavors and spices were very well balanced and everything tasted very fresh. I also really enjoyed the cocktail I had which they said they'd be adding soon to their permanent cocktail menu.   I'm excited to see what the future holds for this place and will certainly be back again for more.

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signature Banh Mi

vfD4veFcdN2rB9aerm6r4Q.text: 595 is definitely a gastropub- the dark, industrial redesign of the former Elements space is highlighted by a menu focusing on brews, burgers, and shareable apps. Visited with some of my favorite dudes and tried a handful of stuff on the menu. Overall consensus was that the slow-cooked pork belly is a standout but most other dishes were on the salty side- maybe this effect is lessened when there is more drinking involved.  The beer cheese app (featuring pretzel rolls from Great Buns bakery) was accented with flaked sea salt that it really didn't need. The roux-based sauce was decently smooth though. The classic poutine arrived to the table slightly cold and with an egg verging on over-hard rather than runny, but the portion size was large and the fries are made from fresh-cut potatoes which always makes them tastier. Needed more cheese curds! The sandwiches seemed to fare a bit better, with the pork belly bahn mi being thick and savory while the fried chicken sandwich (warned as being spicy) was also notably salty. Opting for a side salad over the fries might be a better option if sodium intake is an issue.  Though I don't drink, I'm told the beer list is pretty interesting. There's seating at four-tops, high-tops, and the bar, as well as a small (currently unused) patio space. So far, no word on a happy hour or any brunch offerings, but those will likely come in time. I'm open to a revisit to try a couple of other dishes; the burrata app, bundino dessert, and brisket bahn mi all sound good on paper but I'll give them a bit more time to get the kitchen flowing better.

Hc0e_s5cciacqxq_H0Ktcw.text: Cute, unassuming space for things like sports watching, beer drinking, and food eating. Talk about food eating. Pretty much all the items on the menu sounded tempting. We visited to try their banh mi and spring rolls.  Pork belly banh mi! Tender, fatty, juicy meat and jalapenos a plenty. The spring rolls (thanks pretty Irish bartender/server lady for double checking  these are the fresh spring rolls we wanted as opposed to fried egg roll-type rolls) came with a tasty non-traditional peanut sauce. Dessert was bread pudding - an apple and candied walnut caramel saucy delight. Everything was on point and the service was warm and friendly.  We will come back for more beer and to try the garbage nachos, burgers and the loco moco poutine!

pTzhlVdygLGZVj1wpzY7cQ.text: Great food and service, loved the pork belly sandwich, hang over fries and fried devil eggs. Delish

vFktQgFZGN8j16wOVJXZKQ.text: They get 5 stars specifically for their beer list. I'm so impressed with the menu of beer. Perfect mix of local, import, American crafts... And what a wonderful mix of styles. There were some beers on the menu that I had never heard of or tried before, and some local favorites that weren't the typical ones you see at every bar. Whoever is the buyer is doing a great job.   If I had gone there just for food it would have been a four star review only because nothing was that impressive... almost like they were trying too hard to be crafty? Not sure can't put my finger on it, because nothing was bad... But nothing was really that good.   I would be back anytime though for a cool laid-back ambiance great neighborhood Vibe and again best beer list ever!

Ln44dIBOxeyLWOCdwj8-iA.text: Ok so I have been dying to check out this place and luckily we came during happy hour.  I am only giving this place 2 stars instead of one just because our server Amy was very friendly.  The beer selection is nice.  My friend had one of their specialty drinks and she wasn't crazy for it.. We had the hummus which came with super hard pita chips... suggestion, maybe something softer like pita bread..? Otherwise hummus itself was tasty.  The chicken wings were dry and over cooked. Didn't care much for the sauces.  The "crispy" chicken skins were ok. They weren't too crispy and a bit soggy. Maybe just not fried long enough.  My friend asked for no tomatoes in her $9 salad. Tons of tomatoes in it! Good thing she wasn't allergic but did end up getting real sick. The deep fried deviled eggs were just ok. One piece was enough for me... The Bahn mi slider, or whatever it's called was not good. Hardly no taste and mostly just bread. Waste.  Overall, we were not satisfied with the food. Service was great! Beer was yummy.  Small and cozy place. They just need to improve their food.  Oh and those sheets the food comes on....really? 2 eggs on something that big? We hardly had any room on our tables for everything because of all those metal sheets. Cute but not necessary. Focus more on the taste of the food rather than the presentation please:)

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus, deep fried deviled eggs and crispy chicken skins. Salad and wings came later, thank goodness because there was no room left! Lol

864QBZ_7Kv9uNZgdW_fegA.text: Drove past this place a month ago and couldn't wait for it to open. It's a small bar with big personality. They have a cool craft cocktail program, and interesting beer list. As a bit of a beer geek I am really excited to have a local place with a interesting beer list. The staff was cool, Laid back, and attentive. We really didn't have to ask for anything. I will be going back ........... often!!

HjWn-GHr93GSejpn32bGKw.text: A must try new restaurant/bar! Very friendly staff and fast service. We ordered 2 items:  Signature Banh Mi Sandwich: this was one of the best I've tried. Very flavorful, fresh and they were very generous with the marinated pork! This was yummy! A must try.  The Craft Burger with bacon: the bun was just the right texture! Meat cooked to a medium perfection with just the right toppings!   We ordered 2 orders of the fries, I would recommend ordering one to share. It was big enough for two people. That would be my only suggestion, the server should have informed us of the portion size.   They have a full bar with a variety of craft beers on tap, I'm not a drinker but I'm sure it would be a beer lovers paradise!

_yqNov4gtUebgmUbmB4AEQ.text: First time here and I was not disappointed. Great and fast service. I had  the craft burger and fries. Very tasty! Side note share the fries, pretty big order, enough for two.  They have a big selection of draft beers on tap too.  Tasted the signature banh mi sandwich and I'm pretty sure, it's the best banh mi I've had!    Professional and friendly staff and clean establishment!

yaohPDE2qO28aCmd5K4fuQ.text: Second time here.  Staff was awesome as we had our 3 year and 2 month grandchildren with us. We ordered the deviled fried eggs and they were amazing. xAKU_7IvI3YsJW-WRPCmZA.text: Stopped by this spot with some friends before we went to a concert Sunday evening hopping to hit the happy hour, but they don't do happy hour on Sundays. It's a cute little spot. I hand the deviled eggs, which the egg whites are deal fried and my boyfriend had the chicken sandwich. Both were delicious. The bartenders made our experience!! They were great and a lot of fun!

tIqFMpwyhdduICYLVCx4wQ.text: So my husband and I decided to check this place out last night for a quick bite to eat before going to a show. If my rating could only reflect the service, i would give it 5 stars. We sat at the bar and were greeted immediately. Shortly after, we ordered our drinks and food, and were impressed  at how quickly  everything  arrived despite  how extremely busy the restaurant was. Prior to arriving we looked at the reviews  and pictures  on yelp. And I have to say that the presentation  was just as perfect as the photos. But here's the problem ....... this is where our satisfaction ended .   Although everything  we ordered was prepared perfectly,  2 out of the 3 dishes were lacking flavor.  We had the chicken sandwich,  crab dip,  and bad ass fries. The chili on the fries was extremely  bland. The chicken sandwich was a decent size, and it was so moist  it could melt in your mouth, but it lacked seasoning. The crab dip however, was phenomenal.   Due to the great prices, wonderful service, and quality of food, i would still give it another shot. The chef could have just had a bad night. Overall, a good experience.

jIPwczEpN6e10SkbRM_KvA.text: I went to 595 last night and was blown away. Van is killing it. The food here is awesome. I had the pork belly burger. It was so damn good. The fries are the best fries I've ever had...not kidding. They double fry them. The fries deviled eggs...Service was also great. Beer selection was fantastic. One thing I loved was learning how 595 got its name, as well as some of the local Vegas history with the old race track. This is one of those spots where I don't want anyone to go because I want it all to myself.

SscBx88TRpb0of-wpJimGQ.text: Went here on a Saturday afternoon with my wife and another couple. It was cold inside at our table so bring your jackets. We ordered the spring rolls as an appetizer. They came in a semi-transparent wrapper that felt and tasted like some combination between plastic and rubber. There wasn't much flavor to them at all. If you eating at the same time as others in your party, then this isn't the place for you. They brought out our meals at different times. Not sure why they do that here. Had the loco moko for an entree and it came with a fried egg and beef patty on top of gravy-covered French fries. It was pretty bland as well. They don't have any mainstream beers on tap. The closest thing to bud light I got tasted more like Dos Equis. I'm not sure why gastropubs serve small portion sizes of food in Vegas, but that was, again, the case here. The burgers don't come with fries! You have to add the fries for 3 bucks more. The service was the lone bright spot. They were friendly. If you're hungry for loko moko, better try Born and Raised instead. If you're really hungry, go eat something somewhere else before coming here.

0yfQ4FWJZ3NXYea5uSmztA.text: Talk about good karma, we happened to be in this part of town and I checked Yelp. What a find, super interesting menu, super tasty and super clean! Loved our food. I had the signature banh-mi and my partner had a burger.  He said his burger was one of the best he had eaten lately and would order it again.  I have eaten banh-mi sandwiches all over Las Vegas and this one really stands out, just the right amount of heat.  Great selection of beer. Van brought 2 samples and we ordered a Sierra Nevada. I appreciated the friendly staff, maybe the owner, who checked to see if everything was OK. They will be opening a patio soon. The decor was interesting with a variety of lights and paneling. Important to me was a very clean bathroom.  They need more eye level exterior signage because they are in a strip mall with several other restaurants and their sign is really high up.

8xN_EsPhV5_9x5vje0N9JA.text: My boyfriend and I went to 595 for date night over the weekend on Friday night. It was a little confusing whether or not to seat ourselves, but we did and it took a solid 15 minutes before our server approached us. Once we got our menus it took us a while to decide what to get and ordered and assortment of things. My boyfriend got a cocktail that was called the "queen bee" I believe, and it was fantastic. I highly recommend it. The fried deviled eggs were pretty good, but I've had better before. The pork belly Banh mi was very good and very spicy. We also got a burrata chutney that was good, but where we sat by the window it got cold quickly. So we ate about half of it, then it then it wasn't very melty anymore. Over all the food is good, cocktails were amazing, and service was a little slow but a good experience over all and would come back on a weekday.

I'm kind of new to las Vegas and came to the unfortunate conclusion that the craft beer scene here is horrible. 595 craft and brewery is a hoppy oasis in the barren desert of las Vegas. Not the biggest selection but it's beers you actually WANT to drink. Well done 595. Well done.

The tuna sandwich was tuna steak on a roll with some garlic aioli and some greens and this was $14. All sides were extra. Are you kidding me?

c9BGxt2Eg1c_vf4plt5s9g.text: Yum! I took some coworkers here as we were all out of town visiting. YESSSS to the Bahn Mi!!! They have quite the selection here and I would DEFINITELY return. We got the traditional, brisket and pork belly- all 3 delicious. Also enjoyed the beer selection.

0H8oQ94LEzFTb3hSQ0lG0w.text: Loved the food, service, and how clean the place is! I tried the beef brisket sandwich can I say delicious. The beef was so tender and juicy. I will definitely come back to try other things on their menu!

rkBJ1TtkoibAl0mF67DebQ.text: Food is amazing and beer is good. Highly recommend the "loco mock" poutine, craft popcorn and the BNS beer (blood orange revolver IPA). The bartenders are incredibly friendly as well! Wonderful place!

photos.caption: Photo of 595 Craft And Kitchen - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wdQSjU0uiqo1P08Wungi4Q.text: Stopped by this place before heading into the strip because my friend was raving about it! And boy, it did not disappoint. I had the Pork Belly burger and it was by far the most amazing burger I've ever had. It was so moist and juicy and the flavors were on point. The customer service was great as well. The beers on tap were really good too! When you order drinks at the bar, the bartop has a built in apparatus (not sure what it's called ) to keep your drinks nice and cold. Genius! Perfect for the sweltering heat in Vegas. This will definitely be my watering hole every time I go to Vegas!

DPc1qwj9hrvUi37NIrchSQ.text: Finally got a chance to try this new place out and all I can say is it was awesome.  Van and the staff were very welcoming.  It has nice atmosphere, reasonable prices and great service.  I got to try their Signature Banh Mi, Pork Belly burger, french fries and that Dynamite Crab Dip (Spicy!).  Everything were really good.  That pork belly burger was to die for though!  It's too bad I don't live in the area or I will be stopping by here often just for that burger.  I will definitely stop here whenever I am in Vegas.  You guys should really give them a try if you haven't yet.  You won't be disappointed.  Thanks Van!!!

ZYokmTqmP89Gw742uQHifw.text: Great beer list and friendly service. I dig the thai hummus, which is served in a big wok with great pita chips. I'm really glad a place like this is on this side of town. I wish they had a couple straight up vegan options I don't have to modify when I order, but they get an extra point for playing the new Tribe Called Quest album in its entirety. Can't wait to get back to this place.

FNu2wj4ztmOTGUnz6acplQ.text: Went here on a Saturday night around 11pm. I liked the space, small but nice. Seemed like a cool little neighborhood bar.  Unfortunately the food and service left something to be desired... I tried to order a specialty cocktail from their menu, however it was unavailable. Then I tried to order a bacaradi and coke - no Bacardi so I had to settle on house rum. Then I tried to order pretzels and beer cheese - no pretzels.  The server offered to serve the beer cheese with pita, which I accepted. I also ordered the classic poutine. When my drink came out it was without a straw, as they were even out of straws!! What kind of bar runs out of straws?? Very strange, especially since there is a Smiths right across the street. The food took a long time to come out, about 20 minutes from the time I ordered and it was disappointing to say the least.... everything was cold and just not good. The beer cheese was too thick and bland. The poutine was just ok - the gravy was good but the fries were cold and soggy and the cheese curds were almost non existent.  Overall left feeling disappointed.

skUKDV9JKDg4VJ85-CmEKA.text: Came back for a 3rd time and ordered the chili cheese burger for a 2nd time. One thing I noticed is that the fries were better than the 1st time. The first time they tasted plain or too salty if anything. Today they had a little pepper flavor to it. I enjoyed my chili cheeseburger AGAIN and I added bacon this time I also got more into the craft beer this go/round since I've been trying to step my craft beer game up. I tried the green flash IPA and I'm not an IPA guy. It was solid. I ordered a heffawizen and an orange blood kolsch. All of the beers were good. What's cool is if you are into craft beer is that they continuously switch up their beer menu. The bartenders and other servers were very attentive . I noticed they had a power outlet up front at the bar which was a plus for me since my phone is always dead lol .  The 1st time I came by they didn't have wifi . This time they did. For a craft beer/west coast comfort food spot this  place seems to be on the up & up to me.
